name: Space Travel Jigsaw Puzzles
Reviews:
"Space Travel Jigsaw Puzzles" is a basic asset flip, the developer stole a bunch of photos from NASA and slapped them on a jigsaw puzzle game asset pack from Unity so they could get famous or something.  The only remarkable thing about this is they forgot to slap a huge price tag on it so they can get your money for NASAs images.   Oops.  Anyway this kind of thing could be done in a web browser, no need to go through the effort of downloading, installing and launching something through Steam that your mobile phone or Firefox can do more quickly. doable, love how if i get stuck it can try help by completing for me and tells me which I have already completed. Space Travel Jigsaw Puzzle, NASA'dan gÃ¼zel gÃ¶rÃ¼ntÃ¼ler iÃ§eren Ã¼cretsiz bir yapboz oyunudur. Zorluk arayanlarÄ± tatmin edecek tam kapsamlÄ± zorluk ayarlarÄ±nÄ±n yanÄ± sÄ±ra, sadece bÃ¶lgeye ayrÄ±lÄ±p izlemesi gerekenler iÃ§in otomatik mod. â˜€ï¸ â € [h1]Before I played Space Travel Jigsaw Puzzles, I had a small pp, no friends, no gf, depression, and no life. These things havent changed, but the game is pretty good[/h1] It's puzzles. Nothing revolutionary, but if you want puzzles, you got em Relaxing puzzles of Space! And Earth and stuff. 100% recommend. Easy, Medium and Hard levels.  Beautiful pictures.  No frills, no gimmicks. No purchases or add-ons. No advertisements. This isn't as good as the jigsaw games I paid for such as Glass Masquerade and Cat's Life Jigsaw Puzzles, but this game is worth downloading for free. ;) Really not a fan of this puzzle game. Here's a quick list of the reasons why:

- Modes are called easy, medium, and hard, and don't list the piece count
- On hard mode (which is more what I would consider medium difficulty) the cut of the pieces looks really rough and janky. You can't really tell which pegs fit in which holes because they look like they were cut out by a three year old, but digital. There are stray pixels and whatnot, which makes them a useless indicator of where they fit
- The pieces snap to a grid regardless of if they belong in a place. This is extremely frustrating to me because it feels like I can't move them around as freely as I would expect. Instead of using snapping to grid to indicate solely that you've found a piece's place, it will, instead, snap to the grid and make a loud DING noise when you find the right place. Overall, the feel of the grid snapping is very unpleasant and unnatural to me.

I haven't played very long, but it didn't take long to get the vibe of the game and that's most of where my complaints lie. More power to you if you like the way it feels to play ë°°ê²½ìŒì•… on/off ê°€ëŠ¥, ì„¤ì • ë©”ë‰´ ì—†ìŒ.

I love jigsaw puzzles, but I don't have the space to do them and my pets usually destroy them before I finish. Because of this I've been looking for a good virtual alternative, and this game is it! It felt just like I was sitting at a table putting together a puzzle in real life. No stupid bells and whistles and no complicated controls to take the fun out of the game. I look forward to more from the devs in the future. PROS:
completely free to play
3 different difficulties: easy, medium and hard.
CONS:
no settings (had to mute the music from the volume mixer)

name: New Adult Reality
Reviews: Very limited. Needs more activities. more commands. a better location with more rooms. Also get the kids off the walls. Despite what the store page says, this game requires a VR headset.

 First off let's get this clear, if you buy this because it looms nice, you will be disappointed, as the car you drive is the only somewhat nice texturing.

The cars honestly have terrible handling and feel like the wheels are made of ice. The maps are fun for the first time you play them, but once you finish the 3 only maps, the novelty wears off fast. This game aint worth it man. The only advantage of this game is drift practicing in terms of accurate timing and proper balance of turning and speeding until it becomes a habit. I think this would be better by using a simulator drive wheel. However, there is an unnecessary high texture of the background scenery that slows the game play even in low quality. Whats more, it's extremely difficult that you have a narrow space to maneuver around traffic with a high probability of losing all gained multiplied score points if a single touch happened to the car (sounds like glass breaking) which is a frustrating thing. It could've reduced some points from the score rather than cancelling. That's in addition to the few number of available tracks and the useless options for car suspension and tire adjustment. I believe this was an attempt to make a quick buck. Anyone who purchased this game just threw their money away. Shame. So many small developers are doing this now. God knows how this game made it on to Steam. I'm quickly losing faith with them as well. Unoptimized as Hell.

 Ich muss schon sagen fÃ¼r diesen kleinen Preis, kriegt man richtig was geboten.
Das Gameplay ist halt Typisch Dritstyle, ihr habt unterschiedliche Maps, auf denen ihr euer kÃ¶nnen auf die Probe stellt.
Es ist wirklich was fÃ¼r zwischendurch, da sich die Drift Runden auf Zeit beschrÃ¤nken kÃ¶nnt ihr genÃ¼sslich zwischendurch mal die reifen durchdrehen lassen.
Ziel ist es so viele Punkte wie mÃ¶glich in einer Runde zu machen, ABER erhofft euch kein leichtes Gameplay.
Also ihr werdet es nicht schaffen mit eurem ersten Auto gleich dicke Punkte ab zu rÃ¤umen. 

Ich hab jetzt das zweite Musle Car, und wie ich es mir dachte, jedes Auto hat seine vorhergesehene Map wo das volle Potenzial ausgereizt werden kann. Und so kÃ¶nnt ihr step by steb eure Kombos und somit den Highscore knacken.

Erst mit dem zweiten Auto habe ich es Ã¼ber die 30000 geschafft. Also bis man den hÃ¶chsten Higscore geknackt hat, muss man sich paar Autos erspielen, damit es Ã¼berhaupt mÃ¶glich ist.

Ihr kÃ¶nnt eure Autos anpassen, Tieferlegen, Reifen justieren etc, um die Autos etwas an die Maps an zu passen, aber ich habe da jetzt noch nicht viel unterschied feststellen kÃ¶nnen. 
Also es wirkt fÃ¼r mich eher kosmetisch, so viel habe ich da aber jetzt auch noch nicht rum probiert. 

Im groÃŸen und ganzen bin ich sehr zufrieden mit dem Spiel und es wurde Grafisch sowie vom Gameplay sehr gut umgesetzt, so das es tatsÃ¤chlich SpaÃŸ macht.

Aber ich habe da kleine Mankos die mich persÃ¶nlich stÃ¶ren. 

-- Die EinstellungsmÃ¶glichkeiten 
Es gibt nur Mastersound und Musiksound was es ziemlich Ã¶de macht, wenn man nur den Soundtrack hÃ¶ren will.
 
-- Kollision mit anderen Autos und Leitplanken 
Wenn es zur Kollision kommt, dann wird man zurÃ¼ckgeworfen wie ein Gummiball, und wenn man erst mit der Leitplanke kollidiert, dann klebt man fÃ¶rmlich dran wie Sekundenkleber, und es geht extrem viel Zeit flÃ¶ten. 
Vielleicht ist es bewusst so gewollt, um direkt zu beginn Optimales driften zu lernen, aber wenn es passiert dann wird es schnell lÃ¤stig. 

-- Punkte und Combo Counter
Ich bin noch nicht ganz dahinter gekommen, aber von anderen Spielen kenne ich es so: 
Drift fÃ¤ngt an. Der Punkte ZÃ¤hler fÃ¤ngt auch sofort an. Bei Burnout Drift ist dem nicht der Fall...
Beispiel: Drift fÃ¤ngt an, 3 Sekunden spÃ¤ter fÃ¤ngt erst der Punkte ZÃ¤hler an.
Ob die Punkte trotzdem mit gezÃ¤hlt werden bleibt mir unklar.
Auch ist der Combocounter etwas gewÃ¶hnungsbedÃ¼rftig, denn bei anderen Spielen fÃ¤ngt der nach der Kurve an, und endet bei einer Kollision, oder lÃ¤uft ab.
Bei Burnout Drift, scheint sich der Combocounter erst nach einer gewissen Driftdauer zu 
erhÃ¶hen. 

So ganz aktiv lÃ¤sst sich der Counter aber nicht beobachten, da das Driften relativ authentisch gehalten ist, und man hier auch wirklich aufpassen muss. 
Also im groÃŸen und ganzen bin ich sehr zufrieden, und es macht auch tatsÃ¤chlich SpaÃŸ, da kann ich meine persÃ¶nlichen Mankos auch verkraften, da ich die Combos eh knacken werde mit jedem neuem Auto, und von Runde zu Runde wird es besser und schneller. 

Fazit: klare Empfehlung viel SpaÃŸ zum kleinen Preis da kann man sich nicht beschweren.

C'est ce genre de jeu symphatique qui manque alors merci !

J'espÃ¨re un jour avoir une occasion de travailler avec vous en tant que compositeur. :D nice rogue elements, easy to understand controls and game mechanics. Short description:
You have a party of up to 4 heroes, each on their section of an elevator shield that can be rotated to assign hero to a different quarter.
Each quarter can be: defending the elevator shield from incoming monsters, healing, finding gold, ...
Each floor lasts for a given time (like a TD wave).
You typically have to rotate to heal a given hero, or loot if your best melee hero is also the best at looting, and no opponent is there at the moment...
But more often than not, choosing the right hero for the right task will force you to make very suboptimal compromises with the other (like putting the mage in melee so that your frontline fighter can heal).
After your party demise, you can use the gold found to purchase permanent improvements.

It is a "small light game", but I found it hard to put down, and I liked the twist on the TD/autobattle formula.
 When I got the game I wasn't really expecting to get too into it, but I was wrong: It is quite addicting.

I have played quite a few other roguelites, but none with this specific set of features. The game is sort of a tower defense, revolving around the concept of having up to 4 units standing in each side of a platform which you'll spin based on the current state of things: Maybe you need to heal a unit, maybe one is good with ranged damaged and you want to position it accordingly or maybe one that does high damage through AoE skills doesn't really have the defense to tank enemy hits and you want them safe, etc.

The game has a few issues:
- Some crashes here and there which make you lose the progress on your run (but at least save your gold and runes);
- Some UI elements seem to give incorrect information:
  * The option to "increase agility" states it would take 0.5 seconds off your ranged attack cool down, but it actually takes only 0.1;
  * When choosing a path between towers you're shown which doorways you'll encounter in the way, but that information apparently does not reflect the ones that actually show up.

None of the issues I found were bad enough that they would ruin the experience though.

Overall, I think Gorgon Shield is a pretty fun indie title and it deserves your attention. overall its a fun game but it has crashes so i have to give it a thumbs down until crashes are fixed, or at least a soft save point so you don't lose an entire damn run å¤ªç™½ç™¡äº† æ¯æ¬¡ç©åˆ°ä¸€å®šé—œå¡å°±é–ƒé€€ A very unique and fun little roguelite game! It's got a satisfying game loop with lots of player choice in upgrade, character loadouts, great sound effects, and epic arcade-style music with an announcer's booming voice encouraging you on.

It's short (took me around 5 hours to beat the first time), but there's plenty of replayability in trying out different builds and seeing what works well.

This game does suffer from several issues though. Elaborated on below:

The UI is can get quite buggy, with the tutorial itself even having some UI bugs when pausing during it, and upgrades not registering correctly and upgrading the wrong hero or building. 

The game is badly optimized. This is the dev's first go at a 3D game in the Godot Engine, and it kinda shows. The performance optimization is really not good - my laptop is 7 years old with an integrated GPU, which isn't modern but certainly not ancient - yet the game absolutely chugs at times at 10 - 20 FPS. Tinkering with settings doesn't help any either, no matter how much I turn off or lower fancy effects. This doesn't look like the kinda game that should demand a performant GPU (it's pixel graphics with 3D imposters using 2D pixel textures), though I understand making high-speed 3D games in Godot can be a challenge, having attempted it before myself.

Finally, increasing characters base level (one of the main meta progression ways to get stronger) is very  poorly designed. Character stats are allocated in random areas depending on the additional levels you've earned, when I would really like to choose for myself how to allocate the extra starting stats a character gets, like how it happens inside the Tower. This means getting optimal starting stats (like high starting strength on a high level gladiator) means rerolling again and again until you get the stats you want. Combined with the game lagging quite badly on the upgrade menu's, this gets really annoying very fast.

Finally, the game can crash mid-run semi-frequently. Not the worst, since runs are short and you keep the currencies earned from the run, but still annoying to run into.

Despite all these issues, Gorgon Shield is addictive and fun! Highly recommended, especially for the cheap price point. (though again, beware if your GPU is bad otherwise it might be an unpleasant experience) å¾ˆæ— èŠ The game has crashed multiple times in my short play time, to the point where I can't even finish a run.  And the developers don't even try to fix the source of the crashes.  They built a message into the game so when you log in after crashing, it says, "whoops, looks like your last run crashed, but we saved your gold for you; you're welcome."  Skip this game. The game is pretty good for what it delivers, it could be longer and have more gameplay, more levels/more upgrades and upgrade levels but overall I am happy with the experience.

It is boring, short, unfinished and it lacks appealing interactions. The narrative almost has the bones of something decent: youâ€™re thrown back in time as a lowly servant, but due to great poetry skills, you gain fame. However, becoming famous is skipped over, so the zero-to-hero arc is unsatisfying.

The player-character has no voice over (not a problem) but he barely responds during exchanges. There are rarely any meaningful choices and too many identical scenes. Strangely, unlocked bonus scenes appear at the end of chapters. The three admirers donâ€™t get much screen time, so it is not even worth evaluating them. Some male characters (e.g. the butler) are annoying and take up too much of the story. The only real positives are the sets and costumes.

It will take just over an hour to finish and an hour more to unlock all scenes, which is much shorter than average. The gameâ€™s price is very low, which may justify the length, but the story is unfinished. You get to the end and when you would normally pick an admirer it loops back to the start again. Please make a sequel for it to make it compete and also add more choice such as punching all those douchebag we have to face This game was fun, although I had to be quick at reading subtitles :) [h2]I'm Surrounded by Classical Beauties! (VR - you can act with the actors)[/h2]
I played this game in both VR and non-VR. Since it's designed for VR, this review is based on the VR gaming experience. The VR market is small, mainly developed by indie developers. Players also tend to engage in VR for shorter periods compared to PC gaming, preferring immersive experiences over extended gaming sessions. The length of this game is acceptable for an FMV VR experience. The most impressive part of this game in VR is the feeling of actually being inside the FMV and being able to act alongside the actors.

[h3]The Story :[/h3]
The story begins with you accidentally traveling through time to ancient times in He mansion. There, you meet three ancient beauties who aid you. The story of this game is quite interesting and fun in VR as you play the role of an ancient scholar and with the use of various motions as responses/options makes it much more immersive than just picking an option; it feels like you're truly involved in acting within the game in VR. The only drawback is the absence of the male protagonist voice (I'm not going to voice it myself :P).

[h3]The Viewing Experience :[/h3]
Watching the cutscene in VR (3D 180Â°) offers a unique experience compared to a 2D flat screen. In VR, you have the freedom to explore different angles and focus on various elements, enhancing the visual appeal and allowing you to observe each actor's emotional responses closely, as well as the environment. This immersive experience means you can watch the same cutscene multiple times without getting bored, as each viewing unveils new details or perspectives to appreciate. Besides the speaking actors, the other actors also portray good emotional responses in this FMV, which are clearly visible in VR.

[h3]The Controls :[/h3]
In VR mode, when choosing a speaking option, you select the option that appears in front of you. However, there are other responses/actions that require various motions, such as giving a massage, looking away while the lady is undressing, slapping, punching, etc. You also always see your two hands, which enable you to act with your hands in the FMV. This is a very innovative design.

[h3]The Three Ancient Beauties :[/h3]
[b]Chunlan :[/b] Calm, peaceful, and caring (Taurus or Cancer) 
[b]Yuerong He :[/b] Hot-tempered but without hard feelings (Aries) 
[b]RuYue :[/b] Intelligent and righteous, she also tests your gentlemanly qualities (Aquarius)  

[h3]The Length and Ending :[/h3]
The short duration of this game might not satisfy PC gaming experience, but for VR, it offers a completely new experience that hasn't been seen before, and the duration as a VR experience is acceptable. However, there's a sense that the story's ending could have been more satisfying in both non-VR and VR.
The story concludes when you become [spoiler]the First Scholar and are asked to choose one of the three ancient beauties to accompany you to the imperial palaces. If you start over from Chapter 1, the three ancient beauties ask you this question, but you don't get to choose; the story restarts. This narrative is akin to the feeling of "Unknown why you become a time traveler and keep repeating the timeline while losing your past memory." Nonetheless, you remain unsatisfied without progressing to the imperial palaces and finding out why you have been traveling to ancient times.[/spoiler] However, it is an interesting story of being a time traveler journeying to ancient times, and players want to know more about why and what happens next.

[h3]The Score :[/h3]
[b]10/10 (unprecedented masterpiece in VR)[/b] FMV with various motions as responses/options is a unique experience that hasn't been seen before, it is a very great experience as you feel like you're acting in the FMV with the actors in VR. The acting, music, and story are all quite good, though it lacks a certain satisfaction at the end (deducted 1 point). This game stands as a VR FMV masterpiece (perhaps the best), but its appeal does not extend to 2D flat screen FMV on PC (especially the short length of 2-3 hours).

If you have a VR headset, don't miss out on this VR FMV! I hope it gains popularity and sells well in the VR market. Looking forward to a sequel or DLC exploring the journey of the three ancient beauties to the imperial palaces. è¯´æ˜¯å²éƒ½æ˜¯è½»çš„ï¼Œæ ¹æœ¬ä¸çŸ¥é“è¿™ä¸ªæ¸¸æˆæƒ³è¡¨è¾¾ä»€ä¹ˆã€‚ä¸€å¤©åˆ°æ™šçš„æé‚£åŸè¯—ä½œå¯¹å°±ç®—äº†ï¼Œæœ€æœ€æœ€æ°”äººçš„æ˜¯ï¼Œæ— è®ºä½ é€‰ä»€ä¹ˆåˆ«äººéƒ½ä¼šç§°èµä½ ï¼Œé‚£åˆ°åº•è¦ç©å®¶æ¥å¹²ä»€ä¹ˆï¼Ÿ é€™å€‹éŠæˆ²è¦ç”¨VRç©æ‰æœ‰è¶£, å…§å®¹å“è³ªå¾ˆä¸éŒ¯, æ¼”æŠ€æ²’å•é¡Œ I liked it when miss He wanted to spank me. Ending was abrupt and confusing. Future story? good [h1]A Unique Take on an FMV Game[/h1]
A friend gifted me this game, eager to hear my thoughts, and now I shall share my experience.

Having completed the game with 100% achievements, I feel confident in providing an in-depth review that will hopefully answer any questions you may have.

[h3]The Story[/h3]
The narrative is somewhat fragmented. Set in ancient China, you begin with no memory of how you arrived there and must progress from a servant to the #1 scholar in the country. While the story is generally coherent and easy to follow, an inexplicable time travel scene near the beginningâ€”lasting about 15 secondsâ€”remains unaddressed and unexplained throughout the game.

[h3]The Characters[/h3]
Waifu is [b]Chunlan[/b], she is the only character who genuinely seems to care for you for understandable reasons. 
Also mentioning [b]Master He[/b], your best friend, who is a consistently pleasant character to interact with.

The acting in this game is commendable, especially considering its apparent low budget. The actors and actresses are fully committed to their roles, convincingly portraying people from ancient China, through actions, dialect or mannerism.

[h3]The World[/h3]
The most impressive aspect of this game is its breathtaking sets and backdrops. The Chinese designs are among the most beautiful Iâ€™ve seen in an FMV game, creating an immersive experience that truly feels like a journey back in time. The clothing and hairstyles are meticulously accurate to the period, adding to the authenticity. The traditional Chinese music enhances the atmosphere, making each song a delight to hear.

[h3]The Translation[/h3]
The English translation is clear and quite impressive. A significant part of the game involves couplet poetry, which is translated flawlessly, maintaining its meaning and elegance in English. However, the subtitles can be too quick, especially during written segments, requiring frequent pauses to read fully.

[h3]The VR Experience[/h3]
One of the standout features of this game is its VR compatibility, which significantly enhances the immersion. The VR experience makes you feel as though you are physically present in ancient China, interacting directly with the characters. This level of immersion brings the beautifully designed sets and authentic costumes to life, creating a truly unique and engaging experience that I have never seen before in a FMV game.

[h3]The Ending (No Spoilers)[/h3]
The ending feels abrupt and unfinished, as if the budget constraints forced an early conclusion. The story lacks closure, with no resolution for the characters' romantic or friendship arcs. It feels as though the game abruptly ends without providing the necessary chapter to wrap up the story or explain the initial time travel scene (I still have no idea why it was added).

[h3]Final Thoughts[/h3]
Despite its short durationâ€”around two hours to complete, with an additional two hours to achieve 100%â€”I enjoyed my time with this game. It is very affordable, making it a worthwhile purchase. The developers clearly poured a lot of love and effort into this project, and I hope they can create a slightly longer games in the future to fully flesh out new stories.

[h3]Message to Onetake_Studio[/h3]
The game is fantastic, and offering it at such a low price is a great strategy to attract more players. My advice for future projects is to ensure the story doesn't leave players hanging. Gamers need closure to feel their time was well spent. Nonetheless, it was a very enjoyable game, and I thank you for creating it.

Rating: 6.5/10

[b]Recommended![/b] got punched several times, i enjoyed it ä»æ¥æ²¡ç©è¿‡è¿™ä¹ˆæ½¦è‰çš„æ¸¸æˆï¼Œé¢œå€¼é¢œå€¼ä¸å¤Ÿï¼Œå‰§æƒ…å‰§æƒ…ä¸è¡Œï¼Œç»“å°¾å°±åƒæ˜¯èµ¶å·¥æœŸä¸€æ ·ç»“æŸï¼Œæˆ‘æ˜¯æ²¡æƒ³åˆ°æˆ‘Steamç¬¬ä¸€ä¸ªè¯„è®ºå±…ç„¶æ˜¯ç»™è¿™ä¸ªæ¸¸æˆæ‰“å·®è¯„ï¼ï¼ï¼ï¼ï¼ï¼ï¼ï¼ï¼ thá»i lÆ°á»£ng trÃ² chÆ¡i khÃ¡ Ã­t, nhÆ°ng vá»›i giÃ¡ tiá»n nhÆ° váº­y thÃ¬ há»£p lÃ½, ká»³ vá»ng chÆ°Æ¡ng tiáº¿p theo vÃ  hy vá»ng bá»• sung thÃªm tiáº¿ng viá»‡t
 Some aspects could be improved for sure. But nice overall, would recommend, especially at its price.
Why is the achievement locked on VR play though? Chunlan is Waifu.

This game is very affordable and while much shorter than most other FMV games, it is still a very enjoyable 2 hour or so experience. It also has the unique feature of being VR compatible if that is how you want to play it. While I wouldn't call the story particularly unique or detailed in Cdrama terms, there really isn't many games /like/ this in this more historical time period, so its definitely a treat if you do like FMV and light hearted Chinese historical dramas. 

Maybe it is just my mix of flags I collected while going through the story, but it didn't feel like it had much of an ending (unless its a hidden ending, I may try to rearrange my route a bit to see what I can find later), but the journey is still enjoyable and I would love to see the company make another FMV like this but in more detail in the future.

Also this FMV surprisingly has some of the best English translations I have seen in a Chinese FMV. The game relies a lot on couplet poetry, which shouldn't translate well to English, but the translations are both easy to understand and actually feel like reasonable choices when you pick them. As I have said, for the price you really won't be disappointed.

name: Lies of P
Reviews:
started it becouse i heard it looks like bloodborne, finished achivaments and now I'm sure i wanna buy sekiro next when i get money for it
 ë¹¨ë¦¬ dlcì¤˜ìš” í˜„ê¸°ì¦ ë‚˜ìš” Hyped for the DLC. One of the best and most underrated games of ALL TIME æ“ä½œæ‰‹æ„Ÿä¸€å¨ç­”è¾© The game overall is great, but the initial part feels a bit clunky and can be frustrating. It certainly is a learning curve, the game will be pretty challenging even for Souls veterans.
SOME boss attacks are a bit BS but become fun if you embrace the absurdity of it all.
If you're looking for a VERY fun game with exagerated bosses and presentation, look no further.

The story begins with "ahah twink Pinocchio" and ends with "ahhh sweet, man made horrors beyond my comprehension".

8.75/10 å¥½ semplicemente fantastico. Uh... Ta bien, lo que recomendaria mucho probarlo antes. Ya que la comunidad de souls es muy tiquismisquis con segun que juegos.

Esteticamente me atrae, como bloodborne. Mecanicas pulidas de algunas entregas de souls y otras cosas que han sido utilizadas en elden ring.

Recomiendo encarecidamente que lo prueben antes de comprarlo, si saben de alguien que lo tengan o probarlo en el steam verde de miconoft.

Die Generelle Geschichte im Spiel ist super, und der Endboss eine Extreme Herausforderung.
Das Design ist atemberaubend und wunderschÃ¶n gemacht.
Was nicht ganz so gut war ist das Waffen System der Waffenherstellung, das gefÃ¤llt mir nicht ganz so gut.

å‰§æƒ…è¿˜æ²¡çœ‹å®Œ italian sekiro Lies of P exhibits great craftsmanship in its production - from animations to graphical fidelity alongside the careful attention to detail in level visuals. The Belle Ã‰poque era makes for a beautiful steampunk pastiche and somehow the unorthodox choice of Pinocchio as inspiration for the narrative ended up working well. In terms of gameplay, the excellent balance of parrying, dodging, and blocking makes for solid core gameplay the likes of which rivals the genre king (FromSoftware). Further, the weapon/arm customization and the "P organ" [spoiler](get your mind out of the gutter!)[/spoiler] upgrade tree are great RPG accoutrements. Overall, it is simply a great game. å¿«æ…¢åˆ€ç®€ç›´äº†ï¼Œæ¯ä¸€ä¸ªæ€ªéƒ½æä¸ªæŠ¬æ‰‹å‡ ç§’çš„æ…¢åˆ€å’Œ0.01ç§’çš„è¶…å¿«åˆ€ã€‚

The art direction and atmosphere are wonderful and kept drawing me in throughout each chapter. The supporting characters aren't super deep, but all have enough subtle backstory to give them each their own bit of charm. Only steam game I went out of my way to get every achievement for, very worth the purchase.

name: For Goodness Sake
Reviews:
Love it when a game makes me think - even better when it keeps me thinking after I've finished playing. Neat little game. Interesting to see where Krampus' values lie, and who he decides to punish. This short game was pretty solid. While it doesnâ€™t have a lot of content, Iâ€™d still recommend giving it a try. It has that spooky, grainy atmosphere that really adds to the creepy vibe. This game was just what I needed for a short sit-down alone.
Great Horror WOULD RECOMMEND not a bad game very good. :) 10 out of 10. :) [b]Are you on the nice list this year?[/b]
[i]Only one way to be sure...[/i]
[i]Let's do some more chores![/i]
[b]The sound of jingle bells is near.[/b] A very short game but it's free so you can't complain that much. Has a nice but different graphic style reminds me of the first Terrifier movie it's a shame we didn't see Krampus but honestly a nice little Christmas horror game with some music that sets the tone nicely. This game does a really good job setting up a tense atmosphere without needing to jumpscare you. The questions were kind of tricky to get right, but it's doable. If I have one complaint the graphics are very hard on the eyes. I feel like making things just a little bit brighter would really help there. 
Otherwise it's a solid experience and a fine free game. â€ Ğ’Ñ‹Ñ€Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ³Ğ»Ğ°Ğ·Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ·ÑƒĞ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ ÑÑ‚Ğ¸Ğ»ÑŒ.

Not bad, the ambiance was spooky being able to hear activity outside and around the house. The weird TV grain effect was a little obnoxious for my eyes so I wish I could have toned that way down. Pretty creepy and I liked the 2 endings pretty well. Good, free game! I thought this would be the belle of ball for a Free To Play Xmas Game Friday but it was kinda a snoozefest. 
I LIVE streamed it here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9zC610t0nVg Chat did not seem to be loving it, compared to other FTP games. 
The aesthetics are well done & the music is cool but it's just not scary & the choices presented sometimes don't make sense.
I guess for being created in 1 month & you have some extra time it's cool but I'd say skip this one otherwise. 
I will say I am looking forward to the Dead Letter Dept game though, wishlisted that!

name: Commander: Conquest of the Americas - Pirate Treasure Chest
Reviews:
Arrg buy this no me hearty or walk the plank!  It be worth its weight in gold me boy! Greatly improves CotA, unfortunate the base game is simplistic. DLC for this game are really interesting, adding more random stuff to do.


This game is fun but become complicated after some hours of playing ,overall its a great game for all the trading possibility and the sea batlles.
Easy to handle , a lots of detailled ships , possibility to have lots of fleet for trading or batlle and possibility to set some "automatic trading road, exactly like you want them.
Nice graphic both on the map and during sea battle.
The diplomacy is well done, so you can directly trade some material with the other nations, ask anyone to start/stop doing war and things like that.
You need money to rules safety, and it's fun to make the mission, (better with the DLC).
Still having a lots of fun trying to get the achievment and playing the tactical sea battle.

name: Urban Justice
Reviews:
I wasn't crazy about this game.  It's super cheap (even cheaper now, being on sale), but even then there isn't any good reason to buy this.  There are far better 2d beat 'em up games on Steam that are fun to play and inexpensive.

Hard pass. It is okay as a demo or guinea pig for developer to practice coding. It is not okay as a video game product: repetitive, boring, mindless button mashing, AI is not existent. Urban Justice isn't quite disastrous, but it NEARLY is. The game design is braindead, because spamming jump-kick will solve every conflict with no issue. There only appears to be a single enemy type, the protagonists all control the same, and the storyline is a poor, watered down alternative to genre classics. If someone showed me Urban Justice and told me "this is what beat 'em ups are", I would wonder why anyone enjoyed the genre to begin with. [h1] Um excelente beat' em up. SÃ³ que nÃ£o.  [/h1]

Falando sÃ©rio agora, vou tentar resumir aqui esse jogo da maneira mais fÃ¡cil possÃ­vel. Apenas trÃªs fases/cenÃ¡rios Ã© o que vocÃª vai encontrar. Todos na cidade e visualmente bem trabalhados atÃ©. Um modo histÃ³ria com trÃªs personagens jogÃ¡veis e quatro comandos de aÃ§Ã£o; soco, chute, pulo e bloqueio. HÃ¡ tambÃ©m um modo chamado "skirmish" no qual vocÃª pode escolher um entre 12 personagens jogÃ¡veis, porÃ©m, a maioria desses personagens estÃ¡ bloqueada e Ã© preciso comprar os bloqueados para ter acesso aos mesmos. Na promoÃ§Ã£o, esse jogo Ã© quase de graÃ§a, e se vocÃª quiser conferir todos os personagens jogÃ¡veis, terÃ¡ que repetir dezenas de vezes as mesmas pouquÃ­ssimas fases atÃ© arrecadar o dinheiro para desbloquear essa galera toda. Ã‰ possÃ­vel jogar online com um amigo, mas mesmo assim se vocÃª conseguir ficar duas jogando esse treco, significa que vocÃª realmente nÃ£o tem nada de bom para fazer da sua vida. Talvez seja o meu caso. jugabilidad difÃ­cil para ser un juego casual. Se trata de un juego de Yo contra el Barrio... la trama es una chorrada presentada en forma de comic, distruibuida en 7 actos donde se repite una estructura de luchas con matones, dos saludes, 2 armas y boss final. Tipico. Pero entretenido.

Los controles se sienten bien, y son sencillos, puÃ±o, patada, salto patada, y cubrirte. Suficiente para pasarte un rato entretenido. Me han gustado bastante los grÃ¡ficos y la gran variedad de personajes y enemigos ... poligonales, esbeltos, parcos en detalles y bonitos.

Total, que un juego de puÃ±os para un ratito, por unos centimos lo cumple y ayudas a un estudio. Si te van los juegos de pelea pues aqui tienes Urban justice.

 Habs gerade durchgespielt, macht sehr viel Spass !!! beat 'em up carino,non molto lungo,e abbastanza semplice,piacevole per chi ama giochi stile final fight e simili. Anche il prezzo e' molto "ragionevole",io l'ho preso a sconto a meno di 1 euro,,,, After streets of rage 3 and streets of rage 4 It was The BEST Beat em up Video game :D

When I look back at my childhood beat-em-up games, the likes of street of rage, double dragon, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles or even street figther 1 & 2, you know that feeling of excitement, never getting tired of replaying it and even pushing yourself to perform better. Best when you can't wait for your buddy to come over and play together? I felt [u]none[/u] of those here. 

At it's core, yes the fighting mechanics work great. Different characters have different fighting styles. You can also play co-op now but there are issues with the controls & controllers. Apart from that? Uninteresting gameplay. All I did was mash z and x key from start till the end. I bash up everything from chapter 1 to chapter 7. Nothing else and I didn't even know I was bashing up the "final" boss. What an anti-climax ending/pathetic boss fight. Poor concept/design choice. Skirmish mode? You continue to bash up everything by walking to and back (left and right) endlessly. Enemies are all generic dumb blocks. Might as well turn them into zombies. 

To say that you get inspiration from classics like final fight and streets of rage? and come out with this kind of product? i somewhat felt insulted. Those classics offered more. offered creativity and variety of enemies. Twist the gameplay. Had Cinematics. Had suspense and tension. Had epic boss fights. [b][u]No, you have no right to say that. This is far from what the classics offered! If you're going to put that in your product description, then you have to do A LOT MORE BETTER THAN THIS. [/u][/b] Awful control settings ! Ã‰ realmente muito simples. Mas isso nÃ£o seria problema se funcionasse corretamente. Tem pÃ©ssimo suporte ao controle que do nada pÃ¡ra de responder. Pelo que li, basta reconectar que volta a funcionar, mas nÃ£o vale a pena o esforÃ§o.

Passe longe!
 How do you know a politician is corrupt? When dollar bills spawns from the walls and ceiling of his office, of course!

Once more, I find myself wishing Steam had a neutral rating. The game  is't all bad. It has 3D-rendered graphics (in a chunky, PS1 sort of way). It has three playable characters. It has cut scenes with a story. There's the occasional touch of humor or personality (eg. the spawning money). Oh, and you can stomp on a downed enemy--but only once each time they're knocked over. But there are more ways, and larger ways, that it failed to grab me.

-The story mode is short. It has seven Acts, each a single leve. You have only one life per act, but the difficulty isn't so high that you're likely to die all that much. There is a survival mode where you can unlock other characters using coins that you earn. Since it would take hours of playing to unlock every character, that could extend the game for completionists.
-The move set and gameplay are very basic. You have jump, punch, kick, jump kick, stomp, and block.
-The player characters all feel pretty much the same, and the enemies all behave similarly. The bosses are only slightly bigger than the enemies and have the same moves. I was halfway through fighting the final boss before I looked at his name and realized that's what he was.
-The enemies have rather basic AI, limited to whether they move closer, hold their position, move backwards, or attack. No trying to go around you; they won't even move vertically unless you do. Combined with the limited moves of both protagonist and enemies, this makes for repetitive gameplay. You can beat each level by triggering a wave of enemies (the game has little variation in pacing), maneuvering so they're all on one side of you, and then just timing your attacks right. I didn't use the block button once.
-The story and dialogue are a nice addition but are just so-so.

This little beat-em-up has too many shortcomings for me to recommend it, even given the low price. It hearkens back to the arcade and console beat-em-ups of the 80s and 90s, only with gamelplay less enduring than even the mediocre ones. Urban Justice kept me somewhat entertained for a playthrough of the story mode, but it doesn't have great replay value. Sometimes in life, a person has had enough, whether it's criminals, drug dealers, annoying old people who yell about laws, or their insolent dogs that poop on your doorstep..  When you've had enough of the garbage you become a kick ass guy or gal, or guy that used to be a gal or gal that used to be a guy, or guy that is a girl but ..... (nevermind) walking around just randomly beating people up while you walk down the street .. Male, Female, Greaser, Fast Food Worker, Grandpa or Granma..  it really doesn't matter so long as you can punch them in the face.. 

I like to envision myself listening to Bittersweet Symphony or Staying Alive while I randomly punch strangers in the face or kick them in the groin.. it's all good baby boy.. 

The Story  

Criminals have taken over random city of  Urbania (or something else like that)  The three main characters are making like Owen Hart and saying enough is enough and it's time for a change.. 

Gameplay  

The game is obviously paying homage to classics like Final Fight and Streets of Rage,, even if it didn't say so in the store introduction it would be obvious to anyone who played those games.. If you played those games you understand completely how the gameplay of Urban Justice works..   It delivers nothing new to the genre, nor does it offer up anything unique or different..

The game's storymode is set up of 7 acts..  The game features 3 main characters, they each have 2 of their own acts, and the 7th act lets you choose between the three of them..   It also has a mode called Skirmish Mode which allows you to Endlessly wander down three different locations and fight random enemies and bosses..  (Bosses are just taller, slightly faster with more hp enemies)    Skirmish allows you the chance to earn Gold coins to unlock new characters to use ONLY in Skirmish mode.. 

Pro's 

Mindless button pressing fun
Easy to pick up and play
interesting story (albeit very short) 
Awesome price to content ratio

Con's

Really short story, as in you can finish the story in likely under an hour.. 
Wonky controls, sometimes your character will randomly stop walking or jump into the air
Glitches (sometimes enemies will just stand still)
2 Grindy achievements, see how I have 9 hours of gameplay,,  8 hours is grinding two achievements I still don't have.. just mindlessly wandering and killing boring horribly AI enemies 

Recommendations

It's hard to be too critical of Urban Justice.. the price tag of 1.99 is super affordable.  It delivers little over an hour of unique story content, and depending on how much you like or dislike Skirmish mode the content could be endless..  The game has a few glaring flaws.  If it had a bit more story content that would be great, but considering the price the content is OK..

While other better options exist, if you are on a budget or just looking for something to grab for less then a cup of coffee this game is perfect..    I'd recommend buying it as it'll make for a good couple of hours of fun when you're limited on time and it won't break the bank.. Buy the game and trust that it'll offer you a decent return on your investment.. La storia Ã¨ la solita. Una cittÃ , in questo caso Riverden City Ã¨ piena di criminali e i politici locali sono corrotti. Un giorno, Cris il nostro protagonista stava passeggiando per la cittÃ  quando, nota una donna in pericolo e decide di aiutarla. Tempo dopo, anche Jill viene fermata da brutte persone ma contrariamente alla precedente donna, lei decide di rispondere per le rime. Nello stesso tempo da un'altra parte della cittÃ , Robert un anziano motociclista, nota un paio di delinquenti armeggiare vicino ad un'auto. E lui decide di fermarli. Questo trio tenterÃ  di salvare la cittÃ  dalla violenza che la ricopre. Questa Ã¨ la storia. Il gioco invece Ã¨ un beat em up tipo street of rage o simili, solo totalmente 3d. Ma, per una scelta stilistica, sia tutti i personaggi che gli sfondi sono creati per farli sembrare a bassi poligoni tipo lara croft del primo tomb raider. Solo un pÃ² piÃ¹ definiti. E gli sfondi molto variegati ma adatti alla zona della cittÃ . Il gioco Ã¨ piccolo e i 7 capitoli della storia si finiscono tranquillamente in mezz'ora o poco piÃ¹. Non c'e rigiocabilitÃ  non essendoci livello di difficoltÃ  nelle opzioni. Nelle stesse opzioni bisogna attivare l'opzione: Controller Affinity, di norma disattivata, altrimenti il primo giocatore non potrÃ  giocare con il controller. Disattivando questa opzione il primo giocatore usa la tastiera e il secondo il controller. Invece, le meccaniche di gioco sono povere, i tre protagonisti usano le stesse mosse, l'unica differenza Ã¨ la loro velocitÃ  di attacco e di danno, usando i soliti parametri. Il protagonista Ã¨ medio, la donna veloce ma debole, l'anziano il contrario. La cosa che mi Ã¨ piaciuta Ã¨ una certa varietÃ  non esagerata di nemici, quella che non mi Ã¨ piaciuta Ã¨ che quando un nemico sta a terra lo si puÃ² colpire solo 1 volta o con il pugno o con il calcio. Una volta colpito non Ã¨ possibile colpirlo una seconda volta con l'altro attacco. Senza dimenticare che gli oggetti contundenti che si trovano nei livelli rompendo delle casse. Una volta presi non permettono di attaccare i nemici a terra, ma si consumano dando dei colpi sia a vuoto che a segno. C'e il tasto difesa ma non c'e nessun modo per fare le prese sui nemici. Il personaggio che controllate ha solo una vita, finita quella Ã¨ game over. Fortunatamente ogni tanto, ci sono chioschi ambulanti di hot dog che, una volta distrutti, rilasciano un cibo random che vi ricarica tutta la barra di energia. Ah, durante il passaggio dei capitoli vi verranno donati dei crediti che vi serviranno a sbloccare nuovi personaggi che si potranno usare solo nella modalitÃ  schermaglia. Questa modalitÃ  non Ã¨ altro che la modalitÃ  sopravvivenza, ossia si dovranno affrontare ondate infinite di nemici in uno dei tre ambienti in cui Ã¨ composto il gioco. Ovviamente questa modalitÃ  la si puÃ² giocare in 2. Ogni nemico sconfitto in questa modalitÃ  vi da 1 credito, il boss 5 crediti. Invece come ho scritto prima, nella modalitÃ  principale, solo al termine di ogni atto vi danno crediti, da un minimo di 15 a un max di 30. E visto che l'ultimo personaggio per sbloccarlo ci vogliono + di 1000 crediti vi prolungherÃ  la vostra permanenza in questo gioco. Ma solo se volete sbloccare tutti i personaggi. Altrimenti, vi durerÃ  giusto mezz'ora. Un pÃ² poco per il prezzo pieno ma a poco piÃ¹ di 1 euro e 50 puÃ² essere un'ottimo passatempo, ma in fin dei conti, solo scontato posso consigliarlo e solo se non avete altri giochi da iniziare. Altrimenti, lasciate pure perdere, ci sono beat em up senz'altro migliori senza parlare della prossima uscita di Street of Rage 4. ^_^

Aggiornamento: Visto che hanno inserito gli achievement con l'ultimo aggiornamento, il gioco vi durerÃ  piÃ¹ di 10 ore di noia, per via dei ultimi 2 achievement che vogliono 5000 nemici e 500 boss sconfitti in modalitÃ  schermaglia. E fare avanti e indietro per un minimo di 30 volte nello stesso livello senza che nulla cambi, la noia regnerÃ  sovrana. PerciÃ² anche con questa aggiunta continuo a sconsigliare questo gioco. Incroyable tout simplement incroyable les imperfections qu'il y a dans ce jeu.
Etre bloquÃ© en plein milieu de l'ecran dans les 6 premiers stages alors que le dernier on bloque Ã  
l'extremitÃ© de l'ecran comme n'importe quel beat them up.
Ce jeu est d'une lassitude hallucinante Ã  tel point que je me suis endormi devant mon ecran.
Oser comparÃ© Ã§a Ã  final fight et streets of rage lol il a meme pas 1% des qualitÃ©s de ces deux jeux mythique. This had some potential

Nice graphics, fluid motion and an somewhat polished feeling to it.

How ever the game is let down by boring controls. Kick, Punch and block, thats it. Gets repetetive very quickly. 

My xbox clone controller wont work with it either.... so a thumbs down. 1. Controller behaves quite weird. Sometimes it's not detected at all, and while navigating menus you have to move your joystick repaetedly just to change the postion from default (which happens to be Exit %) ).
2. Didn't play long, but tactics seem to be very repetitive. Movement seems slowish, too. 
3. I don't mind graphics much, but they seem to be either a parody to something or really uninspired.
All in all, I'd recommend looking for something else Has a lot of potential but too many major bugs, especially when trying to use controllers. Also you can't even tell how much life your character has because the gauge always appears full when it shouldn't be.

And don't get me started on Cleopatra â€“ similar to Iru, but there's still a glimpse of hope that you will survive the fight. Unless she rolls an evade. She always rolls an evade. 
 You get a silly low-energy campaign teasing a vaporware game and a bunch of tepid characters therefrom. Both have unique strengths and can be extraordinarily abusive in the right situations, but neither are really important to have. Get it for completion's sake, and for Repa's wacky voice. WARNING: The devs have hidden negative reviews, warned/banned people falsely, the forum can be toxic, bullying and fanboyism is rampant, their mods are awful, plenty of greed, game balance/quality is on the decline, and more. For a character review read-on.

For more information about my warning, check my review:
https://steamcommunity.com/id/carthief/recommended/282800/
This is a friend's review, hidden by devs because it revealed things:
https://steamcommunity.com/id/risbolla/recommended/282800/

(Note: The only reason my reviews are showing up is because the devs haven't found and hidden them yet. So maybe don't mention it to them or there won't be any review left to warn future buyers. Also, disabled comments due to bullies. Message me in some other way if you have questions.)

---

[b]General[/b]:

Officially this gets a negative rating due to the developers' actions. Unofficially, my opinion is that the DLC is alright, even if Ceo is a bit on the weak side and neglected. Overall it's a reasonably balanced DLC, nothing too extreme.

Ceo is your typical evasive unit with a twist, specializing in penalizing enemies who she succesfully avoids attacks of, and Miu is a unusual anti-bully unit with strong (counter-)attacks but limited durability.

---

[b]Ceo (or Ceoreparque)[/b] (4HP, 0 ATK / 0 DEF / +1 EVD, 5 REC):
(Passive: When succesfully evading attacks, deal 1 DMG to the opponent. This counts as battle damage.)

Ceo is a evasion-based unit who specializes in taking down -1 ATK units and Tanks by inflicting damage twice in battle, by succesfully evading the enemy's attacks.

In addition, her hyper is a versatile tool that lets her choose and lock down a single opponent, rendering them unable to move on their upcoming turn and forcing them to re-activate the tile they are on. She can also use it on herself for double bonuses or level-ups on Home Tiles.

[b]Pros[/b]:
-Anti-Tank & Anti -1 ATK.
-Saboteur & Manipulator (Hyper lets her sabotage enemies or help herself).

[b]Cons[/b]:
-Fragile (low HP and evasion-based, and has trouble holding onto her stars).
-Very luck-based (since evasion is all about luck).

[b]Feedback[/b]:
Ceo is a unit that is interesting on paper, but needs work in reality. She can only really exploit units with low ATK, and her evasion-based gameplay makes her fragile and makes her unable to hold her Stars for long, which is not good when she is lackluster at stealing stars.

Her lack of durability also means her gimmick is hard to pull off and generally not worth it, often getting her (almost) killed. I'd consider her one of the weakest units in the game at the time of writing, honestly.

[b]Suggestions[/b]:
-Give her base Max HP of 5.

---

[b]Miu (or Miusaki)[/b] (4HP, +1 ATK / -2* DEF / 0 EVD, 5 REC):
(Passive: When defending, never take more then 2 DMG.)

Miu is a powerful but fragile anti-bully, able to survive immense damage and delivering powerful (counter-)attacks to her foes. In addition her hyper makes her invulnerable to damage until her next turn.

[b]Pros[/b]:
-Anti-Bully (powerful (counter-)attack, and can survive any DMG).
-Can catch up through combat.

[b]Cons[/b]:
-Weak to Tanks & resillient units.

[b]Feedback[/b]: For some reason Miu had +1 EVD and they decided to nerf her, which seemed highly unneccesary. Well, she still works but it feels like +1 EVD was better, especially since she is a "two-hit" unit who must be hit twice to KO (if at 3-4 HP).

[b]Suggestions[/b]:
-Make her hyper ignore damage taken from "Set HP to 1" effects and Instant KO effects.
And...
-Maybe reinstate her base +1 EVD.
Or...
-Maybe give her +1 EVD when her HP is at 2 or lower.

Repa has some nice tactical options. Repa Ã© a personagem com a melhor voz do jogo. 10% da velocidade normal das outras. Tem vezes que uma linha de fala dura 3~5 turnos(online) This DLC is very nice, unique offer for players who enjoy 100% Orange Juice and want some for variety for the game. The price is excellent for what you get. These are characters I personally tend to use, both are iconic in their own right. Two additional great characters, and an extra story as well. You get an additional home marker and board by beating their story on extreme mode. Miusaki is great cause you never take more than 2 damage when defending, shes good in battles. I love Ceoreparque and Miusaki's designs as well. I don't think I have ever played as Ceoreparque despite getting this DLC on it's release, but she's cute. 

I didin't go into as much detail as I feel you can figure that stuff out yourself, all you need to know is this DLC is well worth it if you want some cool new characters and more story mode.

Ğ¡Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ¸Ñ‚ Ğ±Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒĞºĞ¾ Ğ¿Ğ¾ ÑĞºĞ¸Ğ´ĞºĞµ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ´Ğ¸ ĞºĞ°ĞºĞ¾Ğ³Ğ¾-Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ´Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¸Ğ¶ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ, Ğ½Ğµ Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒÑˆĞµ! Ğ›Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ² Ğ¼Ğ¾Ñ‘Ğ¼ ÑĞ»ÑƒÑ‡Ğ°Ğµ - ÑĞ¿Ğ°ÑĞ¸Ğ±Ğ¾ Ğ´Ñ€ÑƒĞ³Ñƒ. ç–«æƒ…æ—¶æœŸä½“éªŒè¿™ä¸ªDLCæ˜¯ç§å¾ˆå¥‡å¦™çš„äº‹æƒ… If you spent 2020-2023 thinking, "man I would love to be the jackboots that enforce this tyranny in the name of fighting a cold", then this is the DLC for you.

Want to send the cops after some guy who decided to go for a jog, instead of staying inside his house? You can do that.

Want to send the cops to shut down a struggling restaurant trying not to go out of business by staying open during restrictions? You can do that.

Want to send the cops to break up a gathering of friends and family, because State Daddy says they can't do that? You can do that.

Want to lose a big chunk of your units because they tested positive on a dodgy C19 test and had to be quarantined? That's going to happen. A lot. 

Want to send the cops to force people into taking an experimental "vaccine" with the most side effects of any "vaccine" in history?  Well too bad, you can't actually do that in this DLC, but maybe this just released before vaccine mandates became a thing. 

Ok with that out of the way...

It's actually a pretty good idea for a DLC.  I think the problem is that they specifically used C19 (or at least a coronavirus) for the pandemic.  It fits in perfectly with all of the fearmongering going on in 2020 over c19, but they don't go overboard with the hysteria or body counts.  You'll have to pick up a couple of bodies of people who died from the virus, but I tend to just imagine they were old and frail people, who likely would have died the next time they caught a common cold anyway. 

With the hindsight of living in 2024, and seeing first hand the contrast between the  insane levels of fearmongering, totalitarian policies, etc, and the actual minor severity of the virus itself, it's impossible to recommend this DLC.

I would have preferred they had gone for a more Hollywood-esque pandemic.  Some fictional virus, higher body counts etc, you know something that would actually justify mass quarantines, restrictions, use of heavy duty protective gear etc. 

Between the cringe of reliving the joke that was the "pandemic", and the annoyance of having so many units get removed for quarantine, it's not worth it. [h1] ĞŸĞ°Ğ½Ğ´ĞµĞ¼Ğ¸Ñ ÑƒĞ¶Ğµ Ğ·Ğ´ĞµÑÑŒ! [/h1]

è£…å¤‡çš„è¯ä¹Ÿæ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªæ§½ç‚¹ï¼Œé€‚ç”¨é¢å¤ªå°äº†ï¼Œé™¤äº†ç–«æƒ…å°±æ²¡ä»€ä¹ˆä½œç”¨äº†â€”â€”é™¤äº†æœ€åä¸€æˆ˜Cosplayå¯ä»¥ç”¨ï¼ˆä¸è¿‡ä¼°è®¡æ²¡äººä¼šæœ‰é—²å·¥å¤«åœ¨è‡ªç”±æ¨¡å¼ç©è¿™ä¸ªï¼Œæœ€åä¸€æˆ˜æƒ…æ™¯ä¹Ÿæ²¡æœ‰è¿™äº›è£…å¤‡å¯é€‰ï¼‰ç„¶åå°±è¿™ç‚¹ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯å¾ˆè‡´å‘½ï¼Œå®ƒæˆäº†å åœ°æ–¹ç”¨äº†â€¦â€¦æ²¡äº†â€¦â€¦ï¼ˆä¸è¿‡è‡ªç”±æ¨¡å¼æœ€åä¸€æˆ˜æ²¡é’±äº†å¯ä»¥å–æ‰è¿™äº›å›æœ¬ï¼Œè¿™ä¹Ÿç®—æ˜¯ä¼˜ç‚¹äº†ï¼‰
ä»¥ä¸Šå°±æ˜¯å¯¹è¿™ä¸ªDLCçš„è¯„ä»·ï¼Œç¼ºç‚¹å¤§äºä¼˜ç‚¹çš„DLCã€‚ Let's face it: The actual COVID pandemic was way worse than what this game portrayed.

Those who complain its too hard should be shoved into the ops room IRL then:
People dying all over the place, EMS staff dropping like flies, only rich countries having the finances for extra supplies.
IRL masks did very little to prevent infection when you are sprayed with infected body fluids.

This game did well to simulate COVID & then turned down the difficulty so it wasnt impossible to beat.
I barely made it past the 3 duties with half my team under quarantine when it was declared over.

Kudos to the devs for understanding & making this.

Would love to see the devs tackle the other pandemics like SARS, Ebola, etc... and possibly regional outbreaks like dengue, malaria, etc. Literal dog water of a DLC. Developers attempt to make it difficult was substituted by making the game painstakingly annoying. It's just stupid to lose literally 11 full staffed patrol cars to quarantine. Then going down to the bare minimum for medical transports, because again quarantining. I equipped everyone with masks, just like real life, it does little to nothing to prevent quarantining. Crazy realism there. But come on! Even when I gave my life flight crew a step down from a hazmat suit, they still quarantined one shift in. That's ridiculous! The "subsidy" I got for the pandemic was dogshit. It was $100,000, when I'm running the whole city of Berlin, literally all the districts and I get half I make as BASE income from the districts I supervise. Like, that is pocket change, not an emergency fund. Let's put into perspective, $100,000, is literally ONE predetermined fire truck. JUST ONE. That's just absurd. It's a horrible DLC when you have half of your staff go into quarantine at the same time. Don't get the DLC unless you like being buttfucked. Like it's just stupid, I put so much time forming this team that spans like 70 units, all named and everything. I quickly am down to like 54 units that are struggling, mainly my paramedics and police. I do use the backup feature, but the amount of money I would have to drop now is absurd, and the pandemic is over, yet everyone still gets quarantined. I would have to drop, $5000 x 11, just to bring police back to speed. $55000, just to have enough police cars and officers to be sufficient for the shift. But let's not forget the huge increase in call volumes for this dlc, it's unreal and just stressful. Of course the job is stressful, but I would unpause for a second, a SECOND, and get 3 new incidents.

[h1] All in All, Ass DLC [/h1]
 Like, I was curious about this DLC, well its a bit shit, nothing special in game mechanics and not even one call with deseased patient (dabing call missing) or something, just buy protective equipment, send units and have half of department in quarantine. Thats all. It could be something special but I guess not. name: Space Ball VR
Reviews:
ArkadaÅŸlarÄ±nÄ±zla eÄŸlenceli bir Uzay Topu oyunu oynayÄ±n! Futbol ve basketbol: Bu sportif ve dinamik oyunda dilediÄŸiniz mod mevcut. â˜€ï¸ poopy game cant join a lobby always full :( better than Gorilla Tag great workout and teamwork! I pumped up my arms with this game hit my finger on my chair while playing it still hurts 10/10 Great fun did a few private games with friends. Most amount of fun ive had in VR in a long time, lots of yelling and screaming.
Thanks devs for setting up OCE servers for us on such short notice <3 Had tons of fun. Hands down has potential to be better than Echo VR. Already worked up a sweat seeing how many times I could dunk on the robot, so it makes me hope that more people will discover this game so the matches will be more competitive. Overall great game!!! The game sets a new direction for VR - arcade. This is the best game in this genre for VR devices and its quality meets all requirements. I really hope that the developers will not abandon the game at this stage, because its potential is huge. I hope that in the future there will be a rating system, and perhaps become the first cyber sports game for VR
Another main feature - the developers regularly answer questions in discord and even hold events for players, together with the development team. I wrote a couple of bugs, which were quickly answered and fixed in the next patch, and updates here are regular. Enjoy my friends Multiplayer doesn't work!!! Please fix it!
We tried to create a room with a friend and play, and we were thrown out when creating.
If you fix it, then I will recommend the game. In the meantime, don't even play. Space Ball VR is an Early Access free to play  VR sports game with gorillia movement.  It worked on my Index system, looked ok, played ok, sounded ok.  Has soccer and basketball gamemodes. Has Bots that are good.

Maybe try this free game, you might like it. My most favourite game in VR so far. Great cardio, nice mechanics, Soccer and Basketball modes <3. Rocket League + Gorilla Tag vibes. Music and sounds are great too. And its FREE =) Space Ball VR is a phenomenal virtual reality game that completely immerses players. With the use of virtual reality controllers, players must skillfully hit a ball into a goal. The game is highly customizable with various arenas and difficulty levels to choose from. However, the graphics could be better, and the game may be too challenging for casual players. Despite these minor flaws, Space Ball VR is an incredibly fun and engaging game that is perfect for sci-fi and sports enthusiasts alike. Great game. Rocket league but in VR. As if you'd play from 1st pov in RL while trying to hit the ball. Its fun and crazy but I got tired after an hour of play. It 100% can and willl substitute a workout lol.

Play it. Especially if you've ever played rl. You'll enjoy it ğŸ™‚ ONCE AGAIN CAW CAW, CROW IS THE FIRST PERSON TO REVIEW A VR GAME ON STEAM CAW CAW. AND WHAT A WORTHLESS REVIEW IT IS CAW CAW.

[h1]Dino Tower Arena[/h1]
Achei o jogo na busca incessante de jogos na steam, e o jogo me cativou de inicio ao ver que o jogo Ã© estilizado em uma pixel-art extremamente bem feita, jogo tem menus bonitos controles responsivos e mecanicas Power-ups e inimigos bem feitos, ele Ã© um Vampire-survivors MAS com dinossauros e seus proprios twists e ideias em um mapa menor e mais focado em outros aspectos como power ups.

Sobre o gameplay Ã© tudo muito frenÃ©tico e muito divertido com Ã³timas combinaÃ§Ãµes de habilidades. Fiquei com um gostinho de quero mais e por isso ficarei de olho nos updates seguintes.

Os upgrades sÃ£o pouquÃ­ssimo variados e extremamente genÃ©ricos, o que torna o interesse por upar seu personagem, meramente obrigatÃ³rio e nÃ£o de curiosidade.

No geral, a proposta Ã© bem interessante e achei o jogo bacana, mas precisa de um Ã³timo polimento em vÃ¡rios aspectos. Very fun arena battle game with a lot of builds to test on. The dinos are very cool and their interesting, when they swarm on you it's very challenging to survive and beat them all, but it's very rewarding when you do it. Can't wait to see the complete game. Simplesmente um verdadeiro confronto entre dinossauros, alÃ©m disso, o game possui diversos upgrades e um nÃ­vel de dificuldade que o torna desafiador sem que deixe de ser divertido. MAS

O jogo tem uma gameplay viciante, upgrades variados e mÃºsicas legais.

Plus: VocÃª pode ter uma cartola no seu dinossauro. I really liked the game, even though it was still in demo mode, the game has a lot of upgrades that change the way you play. I just wish there was more clarity in some parts of the game. For example, the poison skill says that the attack inflicts poison that causes 50 damage, but it doesn't specify whether it's the default attack or if it applies to all attacks we take. name: Aquarium Land
Reviews:
It's okay if you get it cheap or bundled, but it's quite literally a roblox format game. You can play many games like this for free on Roblox. Good for a time waste if you're bored. Simple yet satisfying.
If you're like me and enjoy playing games that don't require too much work whilst you're multi-tasking, then this game is for you. Think of it as an enlarged mobile game in terms of game-play minus the ads of course. 
With my 8 hours of game time, I've managed to 'complete' the game (unlock all characters, animals and areas) and complete all obtainable achievements.
 
This tycoon themed game is perfect for those who enjoy cute creatures, casual paced game-play, catching and selling and earning as many coins as possible. Completing bonus tasks inside the game is also a great way to fill your personal aquarium with fish if you don't like spending the in game currency. 
I do find however that the bonus tasks are very buggy and won't let you claim completed tasks. I have 4-5 tasks sitting there and I'm unable to claim the rewards from them. On top of that, once you've unlocked/obtained everything, the game becomes quite lacking. There's no new quests, no unlockables, no storyline, it just becomes super repetitive at that point. 

Overall I would rate this game: 3.5/5 Aquarium Land is pretty much just a phone game redone on computer, but fixed so that there is no wait for 'in-app purchase' type of content. I enjoyed playing this while watching or listening to other stuff. The gameplay is simple but rewarding, and I found the sealife to be quite cute. A good buy if looking for something simple and satisfying to play. 

Now to the real reason we're here... the achievements. Now I found an exploit to get the badges needed to win the Beauty Cup by buying a bunch of new decor and just spam clicking on it. It's a bit difficult but worth the effort rather than buying the fish for the tank and such to get the badges normally. Overall the achievements were easy to complete (is mainly just completing everything in the game). 

One big issue about the game, the DLC did not work for me. I don't know if I needed to own all DLC, but I got the parrot pet DLC and couldn't use it. Very sad as I wanted a little parrot companion, but hopefully might get fixed in the future :) https://youtu.be/z1wre9t-eJc

Basically a busy work grind fest with an aquatic theme, the astronomically long timers only further this vibe. Itâ€™s just a bunch of random things thrown at you. It feels like a mobile game thrown together with timers and random junk and two currencies and beauty cups and who knows what else. It throws it all at you in a matter of minutes. There is more content but itâ€™s just piling this stuff on in a haphazard way. Maybe if you want a strange mobile game you would enjoy this?

You essentially walk around, catch fish, sell them and use the money to unlock more catchable fish. Every now and then you are given a key to catch a fancy special fish in a cave. There are 9 locations to complete, all with the same things to do but more expensive unlocks.

Sometimes the game felt kinda buggy, too. fishing/aquarium manager tycoon type game. buy more tanks, catch fish, upgrade your speed/capacity, repeat. not mind blowing, but fun. recommended on sale. this is a port of one of those generic phone games. Aquarium Land is the eight game that i played of the QubicGames bundle 20 games for 20$ that happen during every big sale(so far)

The overview of this bundle is if you like repetitive grindy game go for it, if not, don't buy

Aquarium land follow the same formula as dig deep or astro miner where you collect something, buy upgrade collect more thing, etc. The scaling is fine but waiting around for customer to come and buy fish to make your money really sucked. plus the fact that there was no automatic system to make the shopper pay.

I might have given it a mixed positive review if this was my first game of the bundle but it being the eight, i've already seen the formula multiple time and it is getting a bit old. ç¥ä½œï¼Œå¥½æ¸¸æˆï¼Œä¸¤å°æ—¶åæœ‰æƒŠå–œï¼Œçˆ†ç‚¸æ¨è! (ENGLISH + SPANISH)

Aquarium Land: A Stardew Valley, but with aquariums.

Ok, maybe what I just said in the title is a bit of an exaggeration, but you canâ€™t deny that playing this gameâ€”with how relaxing it is and the way you can improve and customize your aquariumâ€”gives you the same vibe as when you play Stardew Valley. That feeling of tranquility, of constant progress, of seeing your efforts materialize into something beautifulâ€¦ itâ€™s hard not to draw the comparison!

Honestly, I really liked the game. Itâ€™s quite good, and for a mobile port to PC, they did a solid job with widescreen support, achievements, and the additional content they added. The progression is super smooth and fluid; you get hooked without even realizing it, and the way you have to manage and organize your different aquariums is an entertaining challenge that never feels tedious. Plus, the fish are absolutely adorable, even though the graphics are quite minimalistic. They manage to give it that cute touch that makes you want to keep expanding and improving your aquarium.

Now, the only thing that threw me off a bit was the music. I understand they tried to make it relaxing, but it gets very repetitive after a while. I think they could have varied it a bit more, maybe adding different tracks for the various areas or phases of the game, because after a few hours, it gets stuck in your head and isnâ€™t relaxing anymoreâ€”it starts to get a bit annoying. But beyond that, I really enjoyed the game. I liked it so much that I ended up getting all the achievements and completing it 100%.

A piece of advice I have for you, and this is important: be careful with the first aquarium, because thereâ€™s a small bug that really messed up my game. Thereâ€™s a moment when you have to catch a legendary fish in a cave. If you fail, thereâ€™s a small chanceâ€”like what happened to meâ€”that the game will kick you out of the cave and you wonâ€™t be able to re-enter. Itâ€™s a weird bug that I found out about after checking some forums, and it forced me to go into my computerâ€™s AppData files, delete the save, and start a new game just to catch that fish and continue progressing.

Other than that, I didnâ€™t find any other bugs that bothered me, and overall, the experience was very positive. In summary, Aquarium Land is a relaxing, well-made game, and if you like titles that let you disconnect and spend several hours in a state of calm, itâ€™s an excellent choice.

Aquarium Land: Un Stardew Valley, pero de acuarios.

name: Memory Patches
Reviews:
I don't like to leave negative reviews, but this game is too rough in its current state. The pictures are neat, but the movement between items and boxes is super cumbersome, clunky, and slow.  That's my biggest complaint.  However, some descriptions also don't make sense and end up differing from the descriptions in the quiz at the end of the game.  I don't know whether I'm answering any questions correctly, and in the end I don't even know whether I got a good ending or a bad one. Polecam 

Chcez zagraÄ‡ z nami? - [url=https://discord.gg/szczepan]Wbijaj na naszego discorda[/url][/b] Guns'n'Stories: Preface VR â€“ A Wild, Steampunk, Gun-Slinging Ride ğŸ¤ ğŸ”«

Get ready to dive headfirst into a world where steampunk meets cowboy mayhem, and your VR headset is your passport to chaos! Guns'n'Stories: Preface VR takes you on a hilariously wild ride through your grandfather's memories, where he was once a legendary bounty hunter. And let me tell you, this game knows how to make sure you never forget it! ğŸ©ğŸ’¥

The dark humor is spot on, keeping you laughing as you blast your way through hordes of enemies while riding the coattails of your grandfatherâ€™s insane adventures. From the moment you grab your gun, youâ€™re in for a relentless barrage of fun. Steampunk gadgets? Check. Cowboys? Check. Ridiculous moments that will have you laughing out loud? Check, check, check! ğŸ¤£ğŸ”§

What really sets this game apart is how immersive it is. The environments look fantastic in VR, and it feels like youâ€™re actually in the middle of an old western movie, but with way more explosions and talking robots. Plus, who doesnâ€™t want to channel their inner bounty hunter and just go full-on gunslinger mode in virtual reality? ğŸ¯

If youâ€™re after a fun, action-packed VR experience that doesnâ€™t take itself too seriously but still delivers on the thrills, Guns'n'Stories: Preface VR is the perfect choice. Get ready for a whole lot of laughter, action, and steampunk gun-slinging glory!
