name: DCS: L-39 Albatros - Kursant Campaign
Reviews:
Probably the best campaign in the whole game. Every desktop pilot should go through this one and learn how to handle a fighter jet. Disclaimer: Don't pay attention to the overall rating on Steam, it's been brought down by noobs who don't understand what they're buying and why!

An awesome atmospheric campaign that takes you through all the main stages of learning to pilot and use the L-39 Albatross training aircraft in combat. Each mission explains and tests the quality of a wide range of tasks from piloting to types of combat approaches.
Highly recommended for DCS beginners as a first campaign, as completing it will give you all the necessary basics of piloting and will significantly ease the transition to more serious modern aircraft. Old campaign. User unfriendly. One tiny mistake (or even slightly out-of-parameters) and you have to re-do the whole mission. Sometimes the messaging about what went wrong is missing. No long supported by its russian developers, nor brought up-to-spec with the latest inclusions in the core game. Do not buy this. Ğ§Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ‹ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğµ Ğ·Ğ°Ñ€Ğ°Ğ±Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¾: Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ´ĞµÑ‚ÑÑ Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ´ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾ Ğ´Ğ¾ĞºÑƒĞ¿Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ´Ñ€ÑƒĞ³Ğ¾Ğµ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğµ, ÑĞ°Ğ¼ ÑĞ°Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ»ĞµÑ‚ - DCS: L-39 Albatros (+60 USD Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ»). ĞÑ‡ĞµĞ½ÑŒ Ğ¼Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾ÑĞ¾Ğ² Ğ¸ Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ·Ñ‹Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ² Ğ½Ğ° ÑÑ‚Ñƒ Ñ‚ĞµĞ¼Ñƒ: ÑÑ‚Ñ€Ğ°Ğ½Ğ½Ğ¾, Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ñ‚Ğ¸Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ğ» Ğ´Ğ¾ ÑĞ¸Ñ… Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ€. ĞšĞ¾Ğ¼Ğ¿Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ€Ğ°Ğ¶Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ÑÑ Ğ² Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğµ. ĞŸÑ€Ğ¾ÑˆÑƒ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ´ÑĞºĞ°Ğ·Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ´ĞµĞ»Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ»Ğ¸Ğ±Ğ¾ Ğ²ĞµÑ€Ğ½ÑƒÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ´ĞµĞ½ÑŒĞ³Ğ¸. Ğ¡Ğ¿Ğ°ÑĞ¸Ğ±Ğ¾. Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾ÑˆÑƒ Ğ²ĞµÑ€Ğ½ÑƒÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ´ĞµĞ½ÑŒĞ³Ğ¸ Ñ‚Ğ°Ğº ĞºĞ°Ğº ÑĞ°Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ»Ñ‘Ñ‚ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑĞ²Ğ¸Ğ»ÑÑ Ğ² Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğµ ĞŸĞ¾Ñ‡ĞµĞ¼Ñƒ Ğ² Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğµ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ€Ğ°Ğ¶Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ÑÑ ĞºÑƒĞ¿Ğ»ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ ÑĞ°Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ»Ñ‘Ñ‚ DCS: L-39 Albatros - Kursant Campaign ĞºÑƒĞ¿Ğ¸Ğ» ÑƒÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ» Ñ ĞµĞ³Ğ¾ Ğ½ĞµÑ‚ Ğ² ĞºĞ»Ğ¸ĞµĞ½Ñ‚Ğµ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñ‹. Ğ§Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ´ĞµĞ»Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ? Very nice, it teaches how to fly properly! This was my first campaign in DCS. Overall I found it great addition to the already available (limited) training that DCS has for almost all types. I definitely wish every single type of aircraft in DCS had a training campaign of this sort to properly learn the airplane. Limited A-A engagement (as L-39 is), but still fun... I personally bought L-39 and this, to get myself prepped for soviet style equipment, which is, as we all know, has its unorthodox parts. 

Downside? You don't find out if you passed a lesson/mission, until you land back at the base, even if you flown the whole route. This campaign perfectly suits L-39 module in a way that they should go in a bundle. Great toolkit to practice navigation and combat application after you read some books.

If you are serious about your flying skills and starting from scratch the recommended path for Soviet planes is Yak-52 -> L-39 + Kursant -> any other Soviet plane. Just like they train in real world. ç®€ä½“ä¸­æ–‡ä¸ºä»€ä¹ˆä¸èƒ½ç©ã€‚èƒ½ä¸èƒ½é€€é’± æˆ‘æ˜¯å‚»é€¼ Nemohu hodnotit jelikoÅ¾ DLC nefunguje! I was hoping this campaign would hold my hand a little bit more to learn the L39.  Being shut down by the virtual instructor as a virtual trainee or "Kursant" in this campaign isn't fun.  The instructor ended my mission told me I needed to go study the books more.  Sir, yes, Ma'am!  I deal with enough training BS in real life that it really turned me off to the way this campaign started out.  I suppose in that way this could be a realistic.  I suppose in that way I don't like it.  Your mileage may vary. Kursant is the best campaign I have played in DCS thus far. This is a fantastic teaching tool for all the skills that real pilots learn, and which sim pilots usually don't care about. If you've played online you've probably seen (or been) [i]that player[/i]: Flying approaches way too high and fast, getting lost, asking how to use their navaids, missing wildly with their weapons, complaining about bad weather. If you have access to the L-39 (it's worth it for this campaign alone), you can apply the skills you learn in Kursant to any other airframe and will hopefully not be [i] that player[/i]. 

Despite being labeled as a training campaign, there's nothing easy about Kursant. In fact, it has many of the most difficult missions I've played in DCS. Generally speaking, in DCS campaigns you can get away with flying like a total moron. That couldn't be farther from the truth here. It doesn't slowly ease you into the hard stuff, either. Mission 2, where you must navigate with nothing more than the kneeboard, a stopwatch, and your eyes, skimming the deck at a 200m AGL limit, maintaining strict speed and timing requirements (in a crosswind to boot!) is the single hardest mission I've ever played. After many attempts, man, was it satisfying to finally get it all right. Thankfully changes to DCS's campaign system allow you to easily skip any mission that is just too hard, and for some of these I wouldn't blame you as long as you give it a proper effort - they are seriously challenging, even for a real-life pilot who's had to do it all before. The challenge is stiff, but logical - every mission builds on those previous, demanding that you master the necessary skills of takeoff, landing, and navigation before you can venture off and start blowing stuff up.

Kursant teaches you more than how to fight in the L-39. It teaches you how to aviate and navigate. Most players probably don't know that the stopwatch even exists, but here it is mandatory. It's used to calculate distance at a known airspeed, timing turns for attack runs, and planning maneuvers. You're forced to read the terrain, look for distinctive shapes in roads and rivers to determine how much you've deviated from a planned course. The briefings are incredibly dense with laundry lists of planned airspeeds, altitudes, headings, and switch settings, but if you follow them correctly you'll never fail a mission due to a procedural error. Flying within parameters is non-trivial - lots of low visibility, high winds, and turbulence, all in a touchy, lightweight jet with no autopilot. The flight instructor is voiced well, and he's very good at reminding you of the flight's action items so you're not constantly pausing to review the briefing. He's strict, but that makes passing the missions even more rewarding and force you to hone your precision flying skills - you must rise to meet the ever-more complicated and demanding flight requirements. Also, those reflector-gunsight dive angle and offset calculations make a lot more sense and seem much more accurate after you've learned how to set up a correct attack run. 

If you're the kind of player who just likes to fly the most modern airframes where everything is handled by computers, do crazy maneuvers and generally fly like shit, you'll hate this campaign. Oh my, will you loathe it. The mission completion parameters are incredibly tight, but that's how it is in real life. When you go to get your pilot's license and have to make a 360-degree turn within 50m altitude, and you oscillate all over the sky, they'll gladly take your money and tell you to try again until you get it right. It's definitely not for everyone. You have to really care about improving and becoming a good pilot not to be frustrated by this campaign, but you WILL come out of it a better pilot, and it's a glimpse into the precision and skill demanded of real jet pilots. ĞºÑƒĞ¿Ğ¸Ğ» Ğ° Ğ² ÑĞ¸Ğ¼ÑƒĞ»ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğµ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ€Ğ°Ğ¶Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ÑÑ ĞŸÑ€Ğ¾ÑˆÑƒ Ğ’Ğ°Ñ Ğ’ĞµÑ€Ğ½ÑƒÑ‚ÑŒ ÑÑ€ĞµĞ´ÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ° Ğ·Ğ° Ğ´Ğ°Ğ½Ğ½ÑƒÑ Ğ¿Ğ¾ĞºÑƒĞ¿ĞºÑƒ, Ğ¢Ğ°Ğº ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğ² ÑĞ°Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¹  Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğµ Ğ´Ğ°Ğ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ ĞºĞ¾Ğ½Ñ‚ĞµĞ½Ñ‚ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ€Ğ°Ğ¶Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ÑÑ If you want to be a better pilot, this campaing is for you. Brilliant and valuable campaign. This will teach you things you don't get in any of the other aircraft but you can apply what you've learned(proper ground attack runs, radio navigation etc) in a lot of other old aircraft like the MiG-15, F-86, MiG-19, MiG-21, F-5E, and maybe even newer aircraft if you don't use EGI/GPS. Definitely worthwhile and definitely wort getting the L-39 just for this campaign. This is a really tough module because of the tight pass/fail criteria expected of you.  Maybe too realistic and demanding for arm chair pilots.  You really need a stick and throttle to progress and lots of practice, practice, practice.  Very satisfying when you eventually pass.  Make sure to set the instruments to metric in your settings.

name: Discord Rich Me!
Reviews:
ğŸ‘ worth [h1]Spielbewertung von TrophyHunter[/h1]

Dieses Spiel oder sollte ich eher sagen Programm, habe ich bereits vor einiger Zeit, durch einen random Steamkey erhalten. Da ich mich neben Steam auch sehr aktiv mit Discord beschÃ¤ftige, habe ich dieses Programm fÃ¼r euch einmal getestet.

Es handelt sich hierbei, um eine Software namens "Discord Rich Me! (Custom Rich Presence)" welche vom Entwicklerstudio "Varstep Studios" entwickelt wurde. Wie der Name schon sagt, kann man mit diesem Programm die sogenannte "Rich Presence" seines Discordaccounts Ã¤ndern. FÃ¼r die Leute die nicht wissen was das ist, es ist die Anzeige, welche Ã¶ffentlich zeigt, sofern du die Standard-Einstellungen benutzt, was du zum jeweiligen Zeitpunkt spielst. ZusÃ¤tzlich kann man dieser Anzeige auch noch 2 KnÃ¶pfe hinzufÃ¼gen, in denen man beispielsweise seinen Discordserver verlinken kÃ¶nnte. Das hÃ¶rt sich ja bis jetzt ganz gut an, jedoch muss ich leider diese Software eher negativ bewerten. Zum einen versprechen die Vorschaubilder sowie die Produktbeschreibung einige Features wie beispielsweise eine speicher bzw. lade Funktion einzelner Statusanzeigen, eine automatische Bearbeitung dieser und noch einiges mehr, welche gar nicht mehr im Endprodukt verfÃ¼gbar sind. Desweiteren gibt es ein Haufen derartiger Scripte bereits kostenlos auf Seiten wie Github. Ebenso gibt es keinerlei Tutorials, weshalb von Benutzerfreundlichkeit kaum der Rede wert sein kann. Was fÃ¼r mich jedoch der grÃ¶ÃŸte negative Punkt ausgemacht hat, ist die Tatsache, dass dieses Programm bzw. die Nutzung derartiger "Scripte", gegen die Discord Terms of Services (ToS) verstÃ¶ÃŸt, da es meines Wissens zu Selfbotting zÃ¤hlt. Zum Test habe ich jedenfalls nur meinen Zweitaccount verwendet. Die Software hat im Ã¼brigen, ganz zum erstaunen meinerseits, sogar 3 Errungenschaften zum freischalten. Der Preis von rund 2â‚¬ wÃ¤re an sich okay, wenn man wenigstens alles geboten bekommen wÃ¼rde, was einem versprochen wird. Da dies jedoch nicht der Fall ist und man desweiteren auch wie bereits erwÃ¤hnt kostenlose MÃ¶glichkeiten hat, diese Funktionen zu verwenden, kann ich den Preis nicht nachvollziehen.

Ich persÃ¶nlich rate euch eher von der Software und der damit verbundenen Nutzung dringendst ab. Das Programm ist in meinen Augen auf Steam einfach fehl am Platz. MÃ¼sst ihr wissen.

Je la recommande en tant qu'alternative de CustomRPC qui n'est pas un logiciel 100% sÃ»r (notamment via les tentatives de phishing depuis la page de tÃ©lÃ©chargement de leur site). The UI is pretty cool but half of the Buttons doesnt even work and most of the time it doesnt work at all.

 D It's pretty easy to understand how to use this software if you've used something like this in the past; it works absolutely perfectly, and it is an alternative to using Discord plugins, like BetterDiscord or Vencord.

It doesn't seem to affect my CPU or GPU usage at all, even if I have the program running constantly in the background. When I used BetterDiscord, it increased my CPU and GPU usage significantly, so if you're using BetterDiscord or Vencord plugins purely for the rich presence, this is a great replacement. Took a strangely long amount of time to set up, very fiddly. id say its pretty okay for the price but you can find alternative free solutions (vencord/CRP) that lack like 2 features and work with modded clients.

name: Droidmals: Lavanlier Town
Reviews:
I've never voted on a steam game before, but this game was so terrible that I had to say something. 2.99 is a ripoff. the combat is terrible, the story is sub-par and the game is shorter than the distance between pallet town and pewter city.

I wish I'd spent the 2.99 on some gum. It would have been more fun and lasted longer. I know my playtime isn't much, but I have some opinions on this little game. First off, as someone who recalls the false ads for a certain mobile game, all I wanted was a horror themed Pokemon game. Droidmals: Lavanlier Town totally fits that bill. My only complaint is that there is no enemy HP bar, making it difficult to see when to catch them. All and all, a fun little horror game for fans of creepypasta like Lavender Town Syndrome and Pokemon: Creepy Black. Prodotto modesto ma che riesce a fare bene quello che aveva promesso, l'atmosfera horror Ã¨ ben riuscita.

name: Connected Hearts: Fortune Play Collector's Edition
Reviews:
This was quite a good HOG game.  There was quite a variety of puzzles, but the HOG scenes themselves were entertaining too.  I didn't skip any of the puzzles, though I did skip the mini-games.  Not so fun.
The story was interesting, a rich man who sacrifices a 'loving heart' to keep the goddess Fortuna happy, kidnaps an actress named Beatrice who is in love with her fiance, Franz.  You play as both Beatrice ad Franz to escape your fate.  The bonus chapter was like half the length of the game and also quite intriguing.

One note: at a couple of times in the game you will be prompted to make a decision.  If you choose not to accept the person's offer, the game will continue but you will miss a significant scene or event.  This option is clearly marked with a red jewel.  If you want to play though it quickly, then skip them.  But otherwise they adds more depth to the story.

Recommended! ^-^ Every single game I got during the sale of this developer has some sort of problem like not being able to get a hidden coin or the mechanics of a game are so bad you have to finish it by skipping or one game the bonus chapter at the very end, the last thing to do was like done for you even though the item you need is still in your inventory so you can't finish the BC at all...no wonder these were on sale ...but really if I could get my money back for all of them I would.   I could get game play out of it but too many issues in each one to play again.   I have played these types of games for years, going back to the big fish days and these have to be the worst because as far as I am concerned this developer didn't care about if their game worked or not.  I saw other issues as well like the instructions to the puzzle games were just awful and I played all of these on easy mode but because they were just so poorly devised some you just had to skip.   nope, this is one developer I can't recommend any of their games ..too many had problems in them. chouette jeu,beau visuel Un jeu excellent! tout est bien! les graphismes, la variÃ©tÃ© des nombreux minis jeux qui ne sont pas basiques,les ambiances une rÃ©ussite! beautiful game enjoyed this game  very much. Nice graphics    recently played again Harika Nice story and cool graphics. Recommended.

name: Forsaken Remastered
Reviews:
Good for nostalgia. Good old FPS. 
Good level designs. Good fluidity. 
Secrets everywhere. Good old cheat codes.
I didn't know I could still enjoy old games nowadays. Nostalgia bait. Runs well. Gameplay loop still holds up. Keyboard and mouse controls work perfectly right out the gate. Classic early in FPS genre.  I love it. have you remastered your foresken yet? A Blast from the past <3 
===================
I remember playing this gem back in 1998 and how wonderful it was.
Nightdive studios did a great job with remastering this game so I can play it on my 4K TV and using Xbox controller, the soundtrack , the motions and everything is really smooth and refreshing.
 honestly i kinda like this more than descent Map Editor with Steam Workshop integration for custom maps when? Pretty please? I require more!... Also fixing some bugs with running the game and staying in lobbies after a round would be cool <3 This game is really good, Its really good with the weapons and alt fires. Go play this game. I enjoy it because nostalgia. Nightdive is very good at remastering old games.

I would not recommend it to anyone normally though. 

No one plays multiplayer, there are no discount multipacks to get your friends into it; and single player is literally a "Where the **** do I go" but with a time limit.

Short of nostalgia; the only reason to actually play this game in the modern day is maybe if you can coerce a bunch of people to play together for a couple of evenings and it's on super sale. Looks better and feels better then in 1998 when the bought the PC version and ran it on my Compaq 386.   Brings back old memories for a guy that is now 65 years now.   My son bought this for me, for my 66th birthday.   Great birthday gift! Top Remake... endlich kann ich es wieder spielen, und das noch in 4K. Suuuper. Crashes whenever I tried to change any options and randomly crashed when in levels. Completely unplayable I listen to the Soundtrack since the release of this beauty of game back in the 90 and love the game still. The remake is from "Descent" quality, buy it! **Forsaken Remastered** su PC Ã¨ una rinascita affascinante di un classico degli anni '90, perfettamente adatto agli amanti dei giochi retrÃ² e degli sparatutto in prima persona. 

**Trama** 

Fps atipico, a tema futuristico dove interpretiamo uno scavatore che ricerca tesori in dei tunnel, non privi di pericoli e nemici da affrontare....tutto qui.

**Punti di forza**:

1. **Grafica Rinnovata**: 

La remaster offre un notevole miglioramento grafico rispetto all'originale, con texture aggiornate e supporto per risoluzioni piÃ¹ alte. 

Questo permette di apprezzare meglio i dettagli dei tunnel e dei nemici.

2. **Gameplay Coinvolgente**: 

Il combattimento frenetico e le dinamiche di volo in stile 6DoF (six degrees of freedom) sono entusiasmanti e mantengono alta l'adrenalina.

3. **Colonna Sonora Epica**: 

La colonna sonora Ã¨ immersiva e ben si adatta all'ambientazione distopica, contribuendo a creare un'atmosfera di tensione e avventura.

4. **ModalitÃ  Multiplayer**: 

Il multiplayer aggiunge una dimensione di competizione extra, perfetta per sfidare amici e giocatori di tutto il mondo.

**Aspetti Negativi**:

1. **Curve di Apprendimento**: 

Per i nuovi giocatori, la meccanica del volo puÃ² risultare complicata e richiedere un po' di tempo per essere padroneggiata.

2. **RipetitivitÃ **: 

Alcune missioni possono risultare ripetitive, specialmente quando si tratta di affrontare ondate di nemici in sequenza.

3. **Narrativa Poco Sviluppata**: 

La trama Ã¨ piuttosto basilare, lasciando poco spazio per un coinvolgimento emotivo piÃ¹ profondo con i personaggi e la storia. Always loved this game since I was very young. Had it on the PS1 years ago.
Nice to see it's been polished up and taken care of.
I would like to see the option to manually change which music track is playing per level though, as some are different from the PS1 version. 
 Still one of the best 6DoF games on the planet.  If you want to test your first person shooter skills this is the game that will do it. Altro omega shooter retro che mi ha fatto male alla testa.
PerÃ² Ã¨ davvero originale This game gives me both really strong nostalgic vibes from my childhood and a strong need to continue flying my drone - albeit without weapons of course. ;)

It sure is dated in looks, handling and sometimes cryptic levels but it makes up for the disadvantages in greatly filling out a niche FPS even today.

The controls are floaty but direct (like it's supposed to be), controller support is great and can be made easier (for beginners).
The difficulty is either easy or kinda hard, depending on your skills and ability to decipher the sometimes cryptic level design. 
Lenghtwise, it's okay even for the full price (17â‚¬) but I recommend getting it for a discount.
I can't really say anything about the multiplayer since I was so focused on the singleplayer.

All in all, I think that Nightdive Studios made a great remaster out of the original material which I can strongly recommend to try out and I really wish that more devs would take on the 6DOF-genre.
 A fun 6DOF shooter from the good olâ€™ days of the PS1 generation, remastered and polished up by Nightdive for modern computers to work flawlessly. I donâ€™t know if youâ€™ve ever had the misfortune in recent times to purchase a game on Steam designed for Windows 95/98 and try to get it to run on a modern system with Windows 10/11, but usually the games wonâ€™t even launch at all without installing some kind of fan-made patch or mod. Honestly, Steam shouldnâ€™t sell those old games without a huge warning mentioning that the game doesnâ€™t run without tweaks. Thereâ€™s quite a few people who have switched to PC from console in the last few years and they may not be aware of this issue.

This game is a fun flying shooter that is reminiscent of Descent, although I would say that this has better graphics (even before it was remastered). Thereâ€™s not much of a narrative going on in this game, but it does have some environmental storytelling and is worth playing regardless. It also runs well on the Steam Deck, right out of the box. If youâ€™re getting older like me and you remember this game from the 90s, you should enjoy experiencing it again in the best version available and experiencing the nostalgia of playing something that is heavy with those 1990s vibes that make the game look and feel so different from any game released in modern times. Pick it up on sale, I got it for less than $10 during one of the big seasonal sales. Best dam game I've ever played

name: LA Monsters
Reviews:
I loved the narration. It was a cool game to let play out while I ate some fruit.

Be aware there is a scene with bright flashing. 6/10 â€ â˜€ï¸ â € Could not get it to work, very sad.
Windows 11 nice laptop, music was neat :( Bu atmosferik etkileÅŸimli video romanda Josh ve Sid ile Los Angeles'Ä±n Ã§orak arazisinde seyahat edin. Only buy this on Tuestays and Fristays. Not a good game, but it was a Stayte of mind. Rest in peace David Stay. [h1]Before I played LA Monsters, I had a small pp, no friends, no gf, depression, and no life. These things havent changed, but the game is pretty good[/h1] this shit is so random, the story sounds like it was written by a child, the visuals are cool af, and the guy narrating is just a goofy ass fella. I love it Ğ•Ğ±Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ° A really cute "visual novel" with no interaction but a great OST and good voice acting
Talks about two brothers in a post-apocalyptic setting trying to save their parents from a terrible "CROW"

It's free and just around 20 min to see/play. Just download it, play it and review it yourselves! we all know that some games are so bad they can be funny, but this is just painfully bad. epilepsy warning too btw. story is acceptable but the narration is fucking terrible and kinda concerning honestly, this man doesnt sound like hes in a healthy state of mind LA Monsters is not a game, it's an e-book/audio book ("Visual novel" is another term that writers use when trying to disguise an e-book as a game) that's been launched on Steam as a game, despite not being one.  As a visual/interactive novel, this doesn't feature any notable gameplay, it's just a lot of clicking through badly written dialogue that would never have been accepted or published in print, which presents the question, "How did something this badly written end up on Steam?".  When someone hoping to become an author is unable to get published in print, they spend $100 and dump their high school fan-fiction onto Steam, under the guise of a game.

The e-book is presented badly with some weird schizophrenic art that looks like they took some scenes from other games or random Blender scenes, put and ugly filter over it, then put stick figures on with MS-Paint.  I'm not sure what the point of that is.  It's a badly written story about two brothers who traverse the "wasteland" of Los Angeles.  

Visual novels/e-books are tedious at best... imagine the best novel you ever read, be that Hitchhikers Guide to the Galaxy or 2001: A Space Odyssey or Twilight (if you have terrible taste in literature), but then translate that to a format where the words dribble out and you have to click your mouse every time you wanted to read the next sentence, instead of just turning the pages. You'd think it was garbage.  

Now imagine that experience, but with much worse writing (because if these guys could write professionally, they'd be published authors and this would be on shelves in bookstores, and they wouldn't have to pay Valve $100 to self-publish this on Steam), and you have your average Steam e-book.

While this is free, it's bad, and badly written.  A basic requirement for me to recommend games to people is that they have to be games... and this e-book isn't a game at all.  My gaming rig is not a Kindle.  If you're on Steam but not looking for games, but are looking for free, high quality, well written e-books and audio books, Project Gutenberg has literally thousands, all much better than this. 3LA5monsters Trippy as this game is, it just doesnâ€™t keep my attention. It also performs really badly for what it is, and the overall tone alongside the improvisation by the different narrators seems like it would work better in a comedy game, whereas this game would be much better suited to a more sombre tone. Even the music, which is by far my favourite part of the game, isnâ€™t extensive enough, with the same few tracks looping for all 39 frames. A really badly programmed joke of an engine displaying this non-interactive VN in the most  obnoxious way possible. The bad graphics are made even worse with the help of some annoying hipster filters. 
You're never sure when you'll have to click the "NEXT" button or when the game will decide by itself to chain several pages one after the other in bad sychronization with the narration. 
The narration, done apparently by a hobo, is the most interesting thing in this software, if you want...
The story is okay. It sounds like it was written by a kid in the 80s or something. Or maybe it's just that the authors are very dedicated to adhering to the analog/retrowave  meme. That would explain the insistance on namedropping "VHS tapes". The whole thing is made more tragic if you imagine it's something that the hobo narrator wrote on a sheet of paper as a kid, and kept in his pockets while living on the street.
 Anyway I'm not sure you'll want to subject yourself to this unpleasant experience just for that banal story. It reminded me of many old movies and cartoons exalting the "childhood innocence" meme, and how overused that theme had been in the past.
Children aren't really innocent or magical and now that I'm older I suspect the people who wrote those old stories were a bit too much into children, if you get my drift.
Anyway...the fact that this game is free doesn't make it good because your time isn't free.


[h1](follow my curator page [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33882793/]GenXPlayers[/url] for more retro and indie reviews)[/h1] It's more of a slideshow of pretty drawings with dialogue that lags behind than an actual game, despite it being referred to as interactive. I think there should be an option to disable the narration, but I didn't mind it too much. It was more so the lag that annoyed me. I'm not sure whether to recommend it or not, considering it's not much of a game, but I think it's worth "playing" for the sake of the story and art, even though I didn't really understand what was going on. Ñ Ğ´ÑƒĞ¼Ğ°Ğ» ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°, Ğ° Ğ¾ĞºĞ°Ğ·Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¾ÑÑŒ Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ ÑĞ»Ğ°Ğ¹Ğ´ÑˆĞ¾Ñƒ Ğ² 5 Ñ„Ğ¿Ñ The narrator from P.T. drank a metric ton of PBR, told me a story that I was utterly baffled by, and used an art style that  fascinated me all while utilizing a visual novel format that made my gaming pc lag and it doesn't even lag when playing Cyberpunk 2077 on it's highest settings. 

It was interesting enough to power through all of that so it's a "yes" from me.

Reviews:

[b]Girls can do anything.[/b] ê³ ë‹¬í”ˆ ì¼ìƒì— ì°¾ì•„ì˜¨ í‰í™”ë¡œìš´ í•œë•Œë¥¼ ëˆ„ë¦¬ì‹œê¸¸Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·. Essential Power is a dating simulator and visual romance novel for all ages. With great renderings, the game stands out for its simplicity, offering an almost kinetic visual experience. Player choices are limited, essentially revolving around deciding whether to pursue a romance or friendship with the female character.

[h3]Story and Characters[/h3]
The story begins with the protagonist going to visit his sister Veronica, a student who works as a waitress in her spare time. The player, who works as a system administrator at a design company, is encouraged by Veronica to step away from work a bit and focus more on personal life.

In addition to Veronica, the game introduces Mia, a co-worker of the protagonist, who is visibly stressed with work demands. Following his sister's advice, the player strikes up a conversation with Mia, opening up the possibility of developing a relationship beyond the professional environment.

[h3]Mystical Elements[/h3]
As the story progresses, a mystical element is introduced through Mia, who shares with a friend about strange dreams she has been having, dreams she doesnâ€™t understand. Although the protagonist does not directly explore this mystery, it adds an interesting layer to the narrative, suggesting there is something deeper going on.

[h3]Interactivity and Gameplay[/h3]
Although Essential Power features high-quality graphics and an intriguing premise, the game lacks interactivity and narrative options. Additionally, the game is quite short and can be completed in less than 30 minutes. For players who prefer a more dynamic and engaging experience, this duration and linearity may be disappointing. However, for those who enjoy a quick narrative with character development and a touch of mystery, Essential Power can be a pleasant and satisfying experience.

[h3]Conclusion[/h3]
Essential Power is a game that attracts with its simplicity and charming characters, along with the intriguing mystical element. However, it may not appeal to players looking for a deeper narrative, more choices, and a longer gameplay experience. This is a very short visual novel, with just 1 choice for you to make, the dialogue is boring and childish and the price is kind of spicy for what it offers. Now with the good things about it, the characters are detailed, that's it. Imo this should've been a free game.

name: Krampus Quest
Reviews:
this game is SLOW STEADILY PUMPING INTO a vague smack in MY EFFING FACE VABBLED INTO A DROWNING GLASS OF CRAP Controls are absolutely atrocious. The game is buggy and doesn't always respond in the way you'd expect it to (e.g. hook jumps feel awkward and wrong). Projectiles, hooks, jumping and just about everything else is sluggish. Restarting the level (or game?) after running out of lives isn't great when at least half of it comes from issues with controls, unavoidable damage, or bugs. It's largely fine on paper, but the issues in execution hold it back significantly. Could be a great short game if these issues were resolved. Octodad metroidvanias aren't fun. Pass until issues are fixed. The game is obviously close to castlevania. The experience I had when playing the game was...ok. It wasn't a great experience even with the issues I'll talk about but it wasn't a horrible one either. In fairness I've only played about 15 minutes so I couldn't get deep enough into the game to say how good it could be. The biggest issues I encountered have to do with the really slow combat. Pressing the button to throw the whip takes a second for the game to respond. Another issue is how slowly the enemies react when getting hit. It feels like those issues go hand in hand but it gets so difficult to play through that I decided to stop playing and uninstall it. I would come back to it if those issues are fixed and give it another try. svin roligt spel, nostalgin Ã¤r ett faktum, barndomens 8-bits action Ã¤r tillbaka =) First of all, this game need controller / gamepad support ASAP.  Other that that, I have next to no complaints. Krampus Quest is fair, controls well, and an excellent throwback to some of the best SNES / PS1 era platformers. 

C- without controller 

A- with controller i like it but i think the controls should be better, other than that the game is great I purchased this on a whim to do a Christmas gaming video on it, but was pleasantly surprised to find a competent Castlevania clone that played well. The only real detriment to this game is the lack of controller support and some other minor issues. But otherwise, anyone looking for a game with a classic Castlevania sensibility with a generous portion of upgradeable abilities should be satisfied with this. 

For the developers, if you guys will add in controller support, autosaving and go back and fix a few typos, then this will be the perfect holiday title. Cheers! I have to ajust my review to a recommendation because the developer updated the game. It now has a basic save feature (although you still start from the beginning of the map after loading a save -not at the merchants tent where you saved the game - but you keep money and equipment). And hitboxes seem to work fine now!

Nonetheless it is (at least for me) a very difficullt game. Old school jump and run. If you like to be challenged then I recommend this game. Until now I was not able to leave the first sector, got stomped in the second boss fight. But with some training I will beat that boss, too.

I really like the graphics and the music so I am looking forward to christmas time when I will play it again. Never expected to see Krampus first come to life as a game through a retro-style platformer but boy is it good!
As the Krampus hyoe accumulated days before release, I was really excited to try out a Krampus game.
I have to say that im really impressed with what I've played so far, it would fit perfectly onto an old NES cartridge.
Only downside is that I wished the mood was darker, seeing as we're Krampus and we kinda consume souls to upgrade our arsenal, I figured i'd be hearing some more castlevania type music rather than your average chip tunes.
All in all, Krampus Quest is an excellent entry into the forbidden territories of Krampus genre games. 
Great job Frozen Rose!

name: Spooky Dwellers 3
Reviews:
IKIGames makes some of the most underrated M3 games out there; I've always found it surprising that they don't get more attention.  The newest Spooky Dwellers features the skeletal ghost writer (no, really, he's an author) Thomassino, who would like your help in figuring out why a certain house is filled with ghosts and to re-house them in a better place.  (Maybe he's secretly territorial and wants the house for himself?  I dunno, but love that pink wig he's rocking.)

There are 90 levels in the first map and 60 in the second (CE) map.  Your goal is to remove all the ghosts and any colored tiles in the playfield.  Usually, the ghosts are hanging out on the edges and you must aim the light beams by removing obstacles and positioning other gadgets to get the lights to shine on the ghosts to scare them off.  The CE map begins featuring creepy critters who are inside the playfield and must be matched next to enough times.  New features to this game are fog, some of which reappears after a certain amount of moves, along with spider web obstacles which must be burned strategically, and chained pieces (which oddly will block light beams, while fog does not).  There are quite a few minigame types which appear every so often between levels in the first map and more in the CE extras: HOS, jigsaw puzzle variant where you rotate the sections into place, mazes, a "click on the sequence" game, and a bounce-to-hit game where you aim objects to collect coins.  The mazes were my favorite and I hope there will be more in future IKIGames releases.  The other CE extras are some wallpapers and character stories courtesy of our hero ghost writer.

Thomassino wants you to build a Playground for the evicted ghosts to live in, but IMO the Playground scene building in this game is a step backwards from the wonderful sim-game side project Spooky Dwellers 2 featured.  If you have a lot of patience where you're willing to play through nearly the whole game to fulfill all the Playground goals, you can get a really good looking scene built - and the Playground expands about 30% bigger when the CE levels unlock.  But if you simply want to get all the ghosts re-housed and the achievements associated with the Playground ASAP, you're stuck with building a really ugly scene, albeit you will get all the goals done with the Playground rapidly (I've done it by the halfway mark of the first map).

The overall difficulty has been stepped up a little bit with each installment of this series, and this one is no exception.  There are levels which can be rendered impossible if you do things in the wrong order, and that red fog can be rather maddening.  The game is still plenty doable if you play in relaxed or normal modes, and there are lots of customization options in the game to tweak the difficulty more subtly such as being able to generate powerups with bigger matches or not and having powerups break obstacles or not.  But beware of that new "expert" mode.  It pulls no punches whatsoever and is a real nightmare to get through!  I accuse a certain beta tester of completely breaking that mode, sorry...  Otherwise, an interesting and different M3.

I got this game because it looked interesting to me. It has that minimalistic design I like, it plays smoothly, there are no bugs... but somehow I just can't sink in it. It's like I am not compatible with this game. It's just not for me even though I love puzzle games. But still, it's not a bad game, not at all. I'm totally sure it can find its own fans. I'm just not one of them. I still recommend it though, it's cheap and it's worth a try. Ã‡atÄ±daki gizemli bir yabancÄ±dan rahatsÄ±z olan mÃ¼tevazÄ± bir bekÃ§inin maceralarÄ±nÄ± takip edin. Oradaki kim?? I really enjoy all of the Google Spotlight Stories. They are short, simple and a great example of how animation can be done in VR. There is nothing to try and teach a new user what to do, just start it and enjoy the show. Special Delivery is a cute one to share during the holidays and feels more like an animated comic strip than a full blown 3D animation. Itâ€™s still worth checking out and showing to someone that claims they canâ€™t handle VR. Just a shame there havenâ€™t been any new stories in so many years now. YO A really cool and really well done VR shortfilm. The star of the show imo is how the makers of this project showcase how to make a paper-cut artstyle translate into a 3D environment. Theres a lesson or too to be learn here in character design and replicating this sort of look. That aside, maybe one of the best Google spotlite VR experience I've seen out of seeing a good 3-4 of them.

ĞšĞ¾ÑˆĞ¼Ğ°Ñ€, ÑƒĞ¶Ğ¾Ñ Ğ¸ Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒ Introduzione
"60 Seconds!" Ã¨ un gioco di sopravvivenza e avventura sviluppato da Robot Gentleman. Ambientato in un contesto post-apocalittico con un tocco di dark comedy, il gioco ti mette nei panni di Ted e della sua famiglia, un cittadino responsabile che deve affrontare l'imminente caduta di una bomba nucleare. Con solo 60 secondi a disposizione, devi raccogliere provviste e salvare la tua famiglia prima di rifugiarti in un bunker sotterraneo.

Trama e Ambientazione
La storia di "60 Seconds!" inizia in una tranquilla periferia degli anni '50, ma la pace viene interrotta dall'allarme di un attacco nucleare. Nei panni di Ted, hai solo 60 secondi per correre per la casa, raccogliere oggetti utili e salvare i membri della tua famiglia. Ogni partita Ã¨ diversa, con la casa che cambia disposizione e oggetti che appaiono in posti differenti. Una volta nel rifugio, la sopravvivenza diventa una questione di gestione delle risorse, scelte difficili e un pizzico di fortuna.

Gameplay
Il gameplay di "60 Seconds!" Ã¨ diviso in due fasi principali: la fase di scatenamento e la fase di sopravvivenza.

Fase di Scatenamento: Hai 60 secondi per esplorare la casa e raccogliere tutto ciÃ² che potrebbe essere utile, come cibo, acqua, medicine e attrezzi. Devi anche trovare e salvare i membri della tua famiglia. La casa Ã¨ generata proceduralmente, quindi ogni partita Ã¨ unica.

Fase di Sopravvivenza: Una volta nel rifugio, il gioco diventa una simulazione di sopravvivenza a turni. Devi razionare il cibo e l'acqua, affrontare eventi casuali e prendere decisioni difficili che possono influenzare la vita o la morte dei tuoi familiari. Gli eventi possono variare da semplici problemi di salute a invasioni di scarafaggi mutanti.

Il gioco offre anche diverse modalitÃ  di gioco, tra cui la modalitÃ  Apocalisse, che aggiunge nuove sfide e storie, e la modalitÃ  Sfide di Sopravvivenza, che ti mette alla prova con scenari unici.

Grafica e Design
"60 Seconds!" utilizza uno stile grafico 2D con una palette di colori vivaci che ricorda i fumetti degli anni '50. I personaggi e gli ambienti sono disegnati a mano, il che dona al gioco un aspetto unico e accattivante. Anche se la grafica non Ã¨ spettacolare, si adatta perfettamente al tono dark comedy del gioco. Le animazioni sono fluide e i menu sono intuitivi, rendendo l'esperienza di gioco piacevole e senza intoppi.

Audio e Musica
La colonna sonora di "60 Seconds!" Ã¨ minimalista ma efficace, con musiche che creano un'atmosfera di tensione e urgenza durante la fase di scatenamento e melodie piÃ¹ calme e riflessive durante la fase di sopravvivenza. Gli effetti sonori sono ben fatti, con suoni realistici per le azioni dei personaggi e gli eventi ambientali. Il doppiaggio Ã¨ limitato, ma i dialoghi testuali sono ben scritti e spesso divertenti, grazie all'umorismo nero che caratterizza il gioco.

Esperienza Complessiva
"60 Seconds!" offre un'esperienza di gioco unica che combina elementi di avventura, simulazione e sopravvivenza con un tocco di dark comedy. Il gameplay Ã¨ coinvolgente e ben bilanciato, con una buona dose di rigiocabilitÃ  grazie alle case generate proceduralmente e agli eventi casuali. La grafica e l'audio contribuiscono a creare un'atmosfera immersiva e coinvolgente.

Pro e Contro
Pro:

Gameplay coinvolgente e ben bilanciato
Alta rigiocabilitÃ  grazie agli elementi procedurali
Grafica e audio che si adattano perfettamente al tono del gioco
Umorismo nero ben scritto e divertente
Contro:

La fase di scatenamento puÃ² essere stressante per alcuni giocatori
Alcuni eventi casuali possono sembrare ingiusti o troppo difficili
La modalitÃ  di gioco principale puÃ² diventare ripetitiva dopo molte partite
Commento Personale
Ho trovato "60 Seconds!" sorprendentemente coinvolgente e divertente. La combinazione di urgenza durante la fase di scatenamento e la gestione delle risorse nella fase di sopravvivenza crea un'esperienza di gioco unica. Mi sono trovato a ridere ad alta voce per alcune delle situazioni assurde e delle battute umoristiche. Anche se alcuni eventi casuali possono sembrare ingiusti, fanno parte del fascino del gioco e ti tengono sempre sulle spine.

Conclusione
"60 Seconds!" Ã¨ un gioco che consiglio vivamente a chiunque cerchi un'esperienza di sopravvivenza unica con un tocco di umorismo nero. Offre ore di divertimento e sfida, con una buona dose di rigiocabilitÃ . Se sei un fan dei giochi di sopravvivenza o semplicemente cerchi qualcosa di diverso, "60 Seconds!" Ã¨ sicuramente un titolo da provare.

Punteggio complessivo: 8/10 :)

But the real challenge starts afterâ€”youâ€™re stuck in a fallout shelter, trying to stretch rations, make tough choices, and not go totally insane. Every playthrough is different, with random events that range from hilarious to downright cruel. The quirky art style and dark humor keep it fun, even when everything goes horribly wrong. name: Veronica's Body
Reviews:
Very underrated game. Reminds of Latex Dungeon. Tedious gameplay and slooow progress. Tranformation mechanic is quite uninteresting. Pros:
 There are not many fetish games like this; it is definitely one of the good sex RPG
 More TF scenes available than Victoria's Body (7 to 4)

Cons:
 Artwork style had changed even though it shares some characters from the previous game (Victoria's Body)
 TF is more like Monsterization, the last one was more like a corruption game  (Could be good for some people)
 Artworks are little weak, only standing CG and mostly text based description This is an RPG game for people with certain fetishes. The protagonist must travel the land and seek out bosses and stones in order to make it to the final boss. In each zone, the heroine will face monsters that are able to transform her body in certain ways. She'll lose or gain abilities as she is transformed. There is a tactical element, because certain abilities will work better against monsters in other zones. Aside from being an "adult" game, it's also a rather good RPG, albeit short and basic. You can buy the standard potions, trinkets, and other items to help your heroine along the way.

 I found the art, music and gameplay to be decent and found no bugs or flaws with the game. 

All in all, I thought it was an entertaining game and would like to see more like it. Pros: 
The combat system is much better! I donâ€™t know if the math was just hidden, but the way hits are registered in Veronicaâ€™s game are a million times better than that 2d10+Skill thing Victoria had to do. The 2d10 was fun, but it kept the action at a snailâ€™s pace with a few bad rolls and made enemies an inconsistent difficulty.
The different buff/debuffs for attacks are really interesting and transforming was done more out of â€œOh I bet this is a good combo!â€ and not â€œOh shit do I need cow tits?? FUck me letâ€™s go collect some crystals!â€
The transformation buildup bars are a better solution than immediate transformation, it keeps the combos useful longer and adds more suspense.
The combat feels better because the grinding isn't as tough, but still effective if you do it.
The art is consistent and well done.
Fitting text descriptions for events/transformations/items.
Cons:
The faces for the art are super cookie-cutter. Everyone has the same round face and it takes away from the transformations. The art from the last game was not as polished, but the character felt truly different when their head transformed. The style let the maid mask look porcelain and the bimbo face look plastic. In Veronica's Body, the head transformations don't have that same power. They just change her lip size or her skin tone, it doesn't seem like a transformation change, just a wardrobe change.
Continuing with the art: I have a siccness for the thiccness, and the artist does too, CLEARLY. But, the amazing influence of the thiccness DOES become less profound when every enemy in the game has the dimensions of the Pillsbury Dough Boy's wet dream. The Willing Willow enemy, AMAZING, understandably thicc, she's a tree woman, fertility and all that. The other flower enemy is also well designed, but the fairy type idea could have been leaned on a little bit more.
The Findom girls are in an interesting situation, I would say they fit well, but I think saving that crazy busty model for the Boss Findom would have been a better idea, because then you would reach her and say "Woah she's orange and has huge melons, she looks so different!" Not, "Oh she's just orange? That's kind of weirdâ€¦". The BDSM pig girls are great though (AND PROPORTIONED IN A NORMAL WAY, BUT STILL HOT).
This kind of idea carries through the other zones(Disregarding the Doll House. The Dolls werenâ€™t overwhelmingly thicc.) The candle girls, and to a lesser extent the Shrine Maidens are both on the crazy end. (To be clear: My critique on the models isnâ€™t â€œThere isnâ€™t enough body type representation and that makes me angry!â€ itâ€™s â€œIn a game about transformation the extremes of every kind of change should be explored.â€ The art is still 10/10 with 6/10 faces)
All in all, don't overuse the sexy ass models and proportions on basic encounters, it takes away from the presence more powerful enemies could have. Keeping the regular people normal, and the elites THICC, let's Veronica's transformations into a THICC whatever-she's-becoming better reflect her power as an individual and it lets her stand out against basic enemies. This can create new dialogue possibilities, reduce the over-saturation of THICC, and accent the MC's special position.

Victoria: Victoria looks like a dwarf with a cleft palate that's short a chromosome. She did not translate well with the art style change.

TL:DR Combat is much better. The transformation system makes more sense. The art is good but too overbearing in places. Victoria looks like a hobgoblin that was dropped as a child. Tickles the transformation fancy 100% and comes along with a solidly polished game.

P.S. It's a niche fetish, and beggars can't be choosers, so I'm signing up for the Patreon and I hope the next game has something like LustFall's art style, if it isnâ€™t, thereâ€™s always the 4th.
 Deliciously bonkers and yet good at being so, such are the games I am having fun playing. Now yes, the adults only tag (rightfully earned in my opinion) is a direct hit to how many people can even find this game, in fact I only found it by pure chance. 

But here's the thing, if you were to strip out the hypersexual nature and edit the story/characters accordingly, you would still have a great game on your hands and that is what I find incredible. The puzzle aspects with the various transformations, both for combat and environment are well thought out and give the game an identity as more than another fetish game.  And some of the tf concepts are pretty original too, I won't spoil them but boy is there a grabbag in here. All of it is given life by the descriptive writing and the well made artwork. If it was just text, it would not have had the same impact.

There is one thing I can say disapointed me, in that there are only a handful of instances where you tf changes how your character interacts with other characters. There are attacks that get insanely strong against you and one or two characters that react differently for story reasons but that's about it. When I saw the status 'Corruption Spreader' after a certain tf, I had an interesting idea where this could go, but it didn't. Not much, just a personal gripe that I quickly got over.

All in all, well worth the purchase for more than just the 'naughty bits.'

name: Low Desert Punk
Reviews:
Surpisingly enjoyable for being so simple. Plus the music alone is worth the 50 cents I payed for it. :D A game that is really challenging and that leaves you completely absorbed in your mechanics.

The game makes you stay focused on hitting your score and beating your friends in a ranking system that always encourages you to play again.

If you want some good fun and some fun, play Low Desert Punk !! Low Desert Punk is a high octane single player free roaming driver where your only real mission is to stay alive by not crashing.  Enemies however have a different goal in mind and will swarm you relentlessly trying to crash you up.  Definitely a lot of hand/eye coordination required here.  Combined with the catchy music, this small Unity value game delivers some fun!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wmle5FkF2ss

Controls couldn't be simpler.  WASD used on the keyboard, no mouse required.  W to go, S to slow, A & D to swirve your truck left and right.  The Space bar gives you a Nitro boost but is limited by a cool down.  Hit the targets, and use Nitro to allow you to get some revenge on the swarming enemies.  Hitting more targets faster helps get you a bigger multiplier to get bigger score totals.  The game keeps track of the top 9 Steam scores so you'll always have a target score total to aspire to reach, which is nice for a game like this.

Game has two modes, both single player.  One gives you 3 "hit" points or 3 lives if you would, and you'll gain a life every level you advance, and the other mode gives you three times the points but only one chance to wreck and your game is over.

You can play with a controller, but WASD and Space worked just fine for me with fluid, responsive controls.

My only gripes were there are ZERO options available.  No sound settings, no resolution options, no key mapping, and not even a full screen/window option.  Bare bones in the options department.  Also there was no cursor on the main screen and selecting a mode and hitting start was tricky for me.. not being able to see a cursor, but that might be because of my dual monitors and might not be an issue for most players. 

My Score for Low Desert Punk is a 74%, mostly hurt by a lower then you might expect "value" score.  Even at the price tag under a dollar, I think the game is addictive enough to make most people want to play it a few times, but that will likely only add up to a half an hour for most people.  Good game and fun while it lasts however!

https://youtu.be/OtDIORr8j6Q This is essentially a dating sim game. You're a medical intern that has to go around and make friends or lovers around the hospital. There are a bunch of people you can interact with. I use the term interact loosely, as your options are to initiate conversations or buy presents. The game opens up as you progress, so there are a few more options available, but this is not a very deep game. 

There are a few mini-games to play to help you earn experience and money. The money is used to buy things to enhance your relationship with the people around the hospital. The writing is decent and the character art is pretty slick looking. I like the 3D effect that's used for the character avatars. Also, the game runs pretty smooth; although there's really not a lot going on visually to tax your CPU. 

On the negative side, the graphics are pretty bland. The hospital looks like...a hospital, but even more depressing. You're basically navigating bland looking hallways to get to each event. The mini-games are fairly simple and this game would have been helped by more variety or complexity. 

Overall, if you're into these kinds of games, it's not a bad purchase. There are, however, better games out there. Cute animation and soapy storyline, just what you might want to pass the time.  The surgical gameplay is unforgiving, but after a while becomes a snap.  Good fun. :)

â˜‘ 10 Ich bin begeistert. Als Neuling in Emergency kann ich mich im Spiel sehr schnell zurechtfinden, die Grafik ist sehr ansprechend und auch die Steuerung gefÃ¤llt mir. Den Kritikpunkt, dass man nicht mehr so viel Micromanagement machen kann, kann ich nicht nachvollziehen, denn durch die vielen Schwierigkeitsgrade ist man immer voll ausgelastet.
Ich kann das Spiel jedem empfehlen, der schon einmal in die Rolle des Disponenten schlÃ¼pfen wollte.

Ich kann seit dem letzten Update das Spiel zwar nicht mehr spielen, aber der Support ist dort sehr freundlich und die Devs arbeiten schon daran, also freue ich mich auf das nÃ¤chste Update. Leider macht es Emergency nicht mehr aus. Die komplette Barrierefreiheit fehlt. Fahrzeuge haben Ihren festen Platz, man kann nur eine gewisse Anzahl an Einheiten steuern. Es Ã¤hnelt Emergency Hq sehr. Ich war nie ein Freund von diesem Format. Schade! I was very happy when I read that there will be a new part of the series. I was even happier to get an impression of the game with the tech test. I was all the more disappointed when I experienced what became of this game.

I've been playing this series since the first installment and each new installment added something different that added to the fun. Things got a little different with Emergency 5 and its subtitles, but ok, not every wheel can be reinvented. I've also played the mobile game Emergency HQ, but that's absolutely not my platform for such a game.
The playtest of the upcoming part was more of a shock. Graphically it's certainly very good, but I'm talking about the general design and the game mechanics. Not even in the first part you were so limited in terms of units and placement options for the units. Everything is reminiscent of a mobile game, the only thing missing (in the tech test) is the in-game shop, where I can buy new slots for units in order to be more efficient. The vehicles (design) and units and their uses are far from any reality (I'm in the voluntary fire brigade). And from the Mechanic tested so far, it's just disappointing. In order to be able to call a unit, another unit must be sent back and once this has completed the task, the previously sent unit can be alerted again. That eludes any logic at the deployment site.

Have the developers ever bothered to take a closer look at the Part 4 and Part 5 mods? Some very good examples of mechanics and design were developed here by the community (LA, Bieberfelde, LÃ¼denscheit, Wegberg, to name just a few examples). Why is one's own fan community so despised?

For me it is clear that I will not buy this game. Endlich wieder freier parken, durch viel mehr Parkslots an quasi jeder Ecke der jeweiligen Einsatzmap (anders als bei EMHQ). Das Multiplayer-Feature ist groÃŸartig! Leider ist das Game des Namen Emergency nicht wÃ¼rdig. Selbst wenn man alleine spielt statt mit anderen ist der schwierigkeitsgrad leider sehr sehr leicht.Kann sich spÃ¤ter vieleicht noch Ã¤ndern. Auch das man die Fahrzeuge nur noch in fertigen Buchten parken kann ist leider absolut nicht meins. Und es ist vieles extrem vereinfacht worden.Man muss z.b. nicht mal mehr einen FeuerlÃ¶scher oder einen Rettungsschere ausrÃ¼sten. Das macht das spiel von alleine.  Desweiteren kommt es mir PersÃ¶nlich so vor das  man nur Versucht das Mobil game gefÃ¼hlt auf den Pc umzusetzen. Ich Finde sie hÃ¤tten lieber wieder ein Emergency wie frÃ¼her endwickelt. Weil meiner Meinung nach stirbt die reihe mit diesem Game. Wie gesagt das ist nur meine ganz PersÃ¶nliche Meinung. Habe das groÃŸe VergnÃ¼gen die Beta spielen zu dÃ¼rfen. Wer schon frÃ¼her Emergency gespielt wird dieses Spiel mÃ¶gen. Die Steuerung ist anfangs etwas gewÃ¶hnungsbedÃ¼rftig aber relativ gut zu erlernen. Die Grafik sieht sehr gut aus. Zoomen raus und rein sehr empfehlenswert um sich einen Gesamt- Ãœberblick Ã¼ber die Einsatzstellen zu verschaffen. Ich denke das Spiel hat Suchtfaktor. Bin mal gespannt wie das komplett fertige Spiel ist. Dla mnie osobiÅ›cie rewolucja w serii Emergency i to stanowczo na plus. Bardzo dobrze siÄ™ gra, dobre dodatki do zabawy. Jeden mankament jaki znalazÅ‚em to strefa raÅ¼enia pÅ‚omieni, mogÅ‚aby siÄ™ zmniejszaÄ‡ wraz z ich gaszeniem oraz bardzo proszÄ™ o wprowadzenie polskiej wersji jÄ™zykowej. Macht sehr viel SpaÃŸ. Es ist recht stabil, keine AbbrÃ¼che und auch bei 4 Spielern ohne groÃŸes ruckeln

name: VR Store Simulator
Reviews:
Game has been a lot of fun! But, there's a few things that need some work to make the game smooth and more enjoyable, in my opinion.
First thing, please remove the weighted physics of boxes when holding a box of items. The way they flop around is laggy and frustrating. The physics on these boxes also seems to create massive lag sometimes, I believe. If the box has tipped over on the ground and is leaning on something else, the game really doesn't seem to like it.
Customers should not have to pick up their bought items one at a time after purchase - surely we can just be 'bagging' them as we're scanning them, to help speed things up? I'm only at level 10 and with the waving monkey out the front, the line ends up pretty long pretty quick sometimes. Can't wait for the update to hire some kid to work the checkout or stock shelves lol.
Custom adjusted prices for items not saving after returning to the game next boot up? Also would love to see a 'pause menu' of a sorts, with a way to exit back to main menu.
Brightness in the store is pretty overexposed during the daytime, its as if the roof isn't stopping the sun or something? I thought it was maybe because of the snow, but I noticed it today as well (snow was removed in the update earlier in the day).
Inputting the total sale price via the pinpad is very finicky to do, I find myself struggling to cleanly input the right numbers most of the time, and I've got a reasonably steady hand.
Please please please put something in for snapping locations of the shelves. Very frustrating and inconsistent to place them down currently.
The way the clock and time works in game seems a bit odd? Can only order stuff from 7am-9pm, but as long as the 'OPEN' light is on, anyone can come into the store? I think it might benefit from a system where the 'day' starts when you plug in the open sign after hitting the button on the clock, so you can do a morning stocktake and order before opening, then customers stop coming in at 9pm when the 'shift' ends. Not the end of the world by any means, but just found it strange tbh.
I think that's all. I've been enjoying the game a lot, but there's definitely room for improvement on a few things.
Also worth mentioning i've played on both a Rift S, and a Vive Focus Vision, with all issues present on both. This game is amazing for it not being out for that long. This is the best vr simulator I've played. This game has a ton of potential too. Good job :thumbs up i like to robing  guys wallets  ( in vr :P
 ) this game has massive potential to be a relaxing cashier game that for some reason makes you wanna keep playing although real cashiers are probably miserable lmao it is a tad bit buggy but with some polishing and consistant updates and care i see myself playing this a good bit. some of the bugs and/or issues are 1) the shelf are kinda buggy to place against the walls at time and can sometime go inside, 2) at day 3 i noticed the customers say they couldnt find flour so i figured i was out but when i went to buy some i noticed i had half a shelf of flour still on my shelf and they still couldnt find flour. 3) some of the products either lose the ability to be gripped or are arent registered in the world bc i noticed customers tended to choose said products.  some quality of life notes (not bugs, more OCD things)  cereal doesnt go on the shelf in an order thaat allows one box to fit so you tend to half to waste another level for 1 or 2  or have surplus, when i buy sugar and flour i get 9 and the shelf fits 10 so when im done shelfing im sad bc my OCD is like EERRRRGGGG lol.  at the end of the day the game is fun and addicting and kinda funny at times but has some issues that need to be fixed in order to be able to scale into something with replayable longivity.   P.S what is up with all of the prisoners!!!!! what prison had a security breach!! lmao

name: Sins of a Solar Empire: Rebellion - Outlaw Sectors DLC
Reviews:
An essential DLC. The roaming NPC-controlled militia ships not only make the game mor interesting to play, but - crucially - also make the whole "Empire-management" aspect of the game more "believable." It really adds a lot the imersion

Edit: I hope they add a similar DLC or mechanic to Sins 2. Rampant Militias is probably one of the best things implemented in this genre of game.

Buy for this alone The Militias are often annoying and or useless but do occasionally have their moments. The pirates are even more annoying and exhausting than usual. This whole DLC is just annoying and exhausting, and the only way I would ever enable it is with pirates turned off. In the original game, the pirates only attacked the player with the highest bounty.

With this DLC, the pirates always attack you AND the player with the highest bounty.  This breaks the game in the beginning.  Even at the beginning, a pirate fleet can't be taken out by one capital ship and continually building fighters to defend your HOMEWORLD.  This DLC should never have been implemented, and having bought the game with this DLC, I am uninstalling it now.  I bought the original game from Stardock years ago, and stopped playing it when they unbalanced the game so bad it was unplayable.  Looks like they did it again with this DLC.

If you want to win, uninstall this DLC.  It will allow you to focus on your enemies.  Pirates don't colonize planets, they simply destroy them.  This DLC can see you trying to fight (and lose) on 4 fronts at once (two enemies plus two pirate raids at once). Lots of new features. Overall worth the price. The idea is great and the content is good, but the only reason I'm saying do NOT get this DLC is because of the changes to Pirates made with this DLC. You can't revert the changes at all during game setups, so you're pretty much forced to disable pirates every time from now on, like I have to.

Avoid this one, buy all the others. It should be implemented in vanilla game for free. Planetary militias are a great addition if you like getting surprised by the occasional massive fleet around an unexplored world. Quite seriously - this mechanic can end up greatly slowing down expansion if you are extremely slow. win10æ¸¸æˆä¸ºä»€ä¹ˆè¿›ä¸å»ï¼Ÿ Not much in it.  But also good price. name: Techno Boy
Reviews:
This is not a terrible game but something I will probably never return to. ĞĞµĞ¾Ğ±Ñ‹Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ¾Ğµ ÑƒĞ¿Ñ€Ğ°Ğ²Ğ»ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğµ, Ğ½ĞµĞ¾Ğ±Ñ‹Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ°Ñ Ğ¼ÑƒĞ·Ñ‹ĞºĞ°. Ğ›Ñ‘Ğ³ĞºĞ°Ñ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ° Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ‹ Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ´Ğ¾Ñ…Ğ½ÑƒÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑĞ»Ğµ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ±Ğ¾Ñ‚Ñ‹. Ğ¡Ğ¿Ğ°ÑĞ¸Ğ±Ğ¾ Ğ¾Ğ³Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¼Ğ½Ğ¾Ğµ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ñ€Ğ°Ğ±Ğ¾Ñ‚Ñ‡Ğ¸ĞºĞ°Ğ¼ Ğ¸ Ğ²ÑĞµĞ¼ ĞºÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğ°Ğ» ÑƒÑ‡Ğ°ÑÑ‚Ğ¸Ğµ Ğ² ÑĞ¾Ğ·Ğ´Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¸ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñ‹. Ğ’ Ğ¾ÑĞ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¼ ĞµÑĞ»Ğ¸ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ½Ğ° ĞºĞ»Ğ°Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ°Ñ‚ÑƒÑ€Ğµ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ³ÑƒÑ‚ Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ½ÑƒÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ»ĞµĞ¼Ñ‹ Ñ Ğ¿Ñ€Ñ‹Ğ¶ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼ Ñƒ Ğ¢ĞµÑ…Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ğ½Ñ, Ğ½Ğ¾ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¼ĞµĞ»Ğ¾Ñ‡Ğ¸) Very good hardcore platformer with nice varied visuals and great techno music.  

There are 4 worlds to explore, each world is made up of 15 levels for a total of 60 levels.  Each world has a different aesthetic and completely different sets of obstacles giving every world a very different feel.  The first few levels of each world are very easy, they are basically there to show you how the traps/level hazards work in that stage and then after a few training levels in that world the real challenges begin.  

The difficulty curve in this game is great, it is a hard game and you will die a decent amount, but it is not frustrating.  Every time you die it is your fault and because of instant respawns you will jump right back into action and learn from your mistakes.  This game did a great job of always making me feel like I would beat the level on my next try which really keeps you in the action.   Many levels also offer a degree of flexibility in how you handle them and often just changing your approach to a level can make it much easier.

Controls are fast, when you first play them you will probably think they are too fast, but you will get the hang of them.  Controls are simple, you can walk (very quickly) left to right and you have a jump button, tapping jump produces short jumps and holding it produces long jumps.  You also have a mid-air dash move that lets you cover a lot of ground quickly and you can cling to walls and bounce up them/back and forth between them.  It is all pretty standard fare but it works well here.

A few complaints:

1) The jump button is mapped to Y on the xbox pad by default, very weird, make sure you change it before the game starts.

2) The game does not work with the control pad, this is a pretty huge deal.  I use a logitech controller with a button that turns the stick into the dpad and vice versa but if you are playing with an xbox controller you will be forced to use the stick.   Personally, this would have made the game unplayable for me, and it is definitely something the devs need to fix, precision games like this are made to be played with a dpad.

3) No mid level checkpoints, granted most levels are short and don't really need them, but some levels drag on a bit and a mid level checkpoint would have been nice, especially on the final level.

4) The final level is disproportionately difficult compared to the rest of the game.  Yes, I know its the final level, but for a game with such a nice difficulty curve there is simply no reason for the last level to be that much harder than the rest of the game.  I think up to the final level I died a total of around 150 times, on the final level I died around 80 times, that tells you something is off.  I almost quit the game but decided to stick it out and was rewarded with a completely crap ending, not that a game like this really has a story but it still felt like an f you.

Overall, techno boy is a really fun platformer and if you are into this genre I can't imagine you not enjoying it. Por que Esta Bien Shoriso
